Raining like hell darn the place.

Entry.6: am here at Lynde, came to Hazlebruk first then after four hours mooning about sent back here. feel Rotten
Entry.7: Nothing doing & no Rations till Thursday morning, fine Army system this starve a man because he has been on leave
Entry.8:
couldn’t enter up much in my Diary have been too much upset after leaving London & the messing up job of getting here & two days with no Rations to go on with. Came as far as Hailsbruck then back here to Lynde. Will be here some time yet.

Bat. away but doesn’t it hurt, almost wish I hadn’t gone. Couldn’t see Maude hadn’t time. Its a beautiful time going to & Back from Blighty I don’t think, am amongst some cranks here talk war all day or else play an infernal accordion all the time talk about nerve stretchers these take the band curse them.Thunderstorms every afternoon & lightening very bad. The women here very frightened of it, hope I get my other stripe soon.
Entry.9:
not think I ever felt like this before thank goodness the Bat was away. when I got here, my nerves were gone to pieces with the rushing about London etc. Hope that £10- arrives soon owe £3- out of it to Parkes. don’t know what he will think of my using his money although he told me to do so if I wanted it. Batl will be back tomorrow night.

Huns Bombed Hazebruk last night at 12 & shelled it at 4 this morning from 18 miles away Killed some women & children & wounded a few.
Entry.10: Boys came in today & the place is noisy again, Paid Parks 10/- owe him 50/- letter from Viv which he sent before I left for England. Got a bad posy for sleeping in here the one before was between a Pig house & Calf House, this has been used by cows & hens. Nice & fine today. Taubes bombed a place about 5 kilos from here trying to get an amunition factory or dump. This morning - shelled Hazelbruk again, supposed to have killed 70 Tommies in a hospital yesterday and some civilians also wounded some ausy’s. Aeroplanes about all day & night. Stony broke again. It’s awful to see the Refugies coming in carrying all they can scrape together in Bundles on their Backs & leading children likewise, also some with carts full of furniture & Bedding etc. from Hazelbruk.
Entry.11: All up for inspection this morning (Genl). Huns shelled Hazelbruk again last night can see flares from here of Battle front will soon be there now, Am feeling nearly alright again, no letters yet shall write tomorrow. Been raining & looks like more seems to me Winter will soon be on us. Am billeted at the back of the Brewery & its fine for getting hot water & plenty of it. Paid Parkes 24/8 out of the 60/- I borrowed Owe Joe Transport 20 francs Terrific Thunderstorm to night Lightening very bad & Rain in Torrents out in it all on Duty. Guns don’t stop all the same.
Entry.12:
A lovely morning but more rain hanging round, rains every day. Going for Bath this morning. Dont know when we leave here Lynde. Wrote to Nell, Jack, Carol, Tony. Also Perpetual Trustee Coy. for an extra £5.– making £15 in all the other £10 should be in London now. also A.I.F. Head Quarters & Commonwealth Bank. London. 2 Women Prisoners from Lille who were sent to Leige & who got away to Switzerland arrived here to day & caused great excitement, they were 5 days Travelling to get here. Route March Tomorrow am exempt. This is the cleanest place I have been in in France (that is Village).

Heavy firing all night
Entry.13:
Route March, plenty of refugees here now from Hazelbruk. Poor People some of them dressed well in the latest some in Black in fact mostly in black.

Weather fine but rain hanging round.
Entry.14:
Fine but muggy slight rain this morning terrific Bombardment last night north of Ypres could hear it distinctly & feel the vibration must have been awful, started 3. a.m. till about 7. Stationer Master at Hazelbruk taken for spy yesterday. lot of nippers about here awfully like Fritz’s. Expect pay tomorrow I wont get much.

Always sleepy here & they tell me I am getting fat "I dont think." deferred pay £30.1.0. Had a Bath & got new shirt & Sox feel quite Lovely.

Big Procession of French People Tomorrow to the Church. Very much like rain again. The crops are looking grand all over France & theres little fear of them starving here I said the same thing this time last year. when we were at Fleurbaix. Raining. 5 minutes after writing the above.
Entry.15: deferred pay £30.2.0. Rain & shine. took 5 Prisoners for a bath this morning, up at 6.30 all church to day with the French People Put the acid on the R.S.M. for my other stripe says he will see about it. Another fierce storm last night this place takes the bun.
Entry.16: fine but rain about Keeps spitting. Route march two of us left behind. Pay day to day. expect I shall get about 10 francs. deferred £30.3.0. feeling well.
Entry.17:
Aug 17/17

deferred £30.4.0. Borrowed 25 francs from the Boys, Paid 20 francs to Joe Transport. Been a lovely day, took Prisoners for Route March this morning about 7 miles they are not so keen on exercise now. Am expecting my other stripe soon now. British wining all along the line. Peace I dont think.
Entry.18: Taubes up last night over Hazebruk aircraft guns blazing at them, search-lights etc. did not stay long. Planes very busy round this way lately both sides. a beautiful day again but heavy clouds keep coming up. Wrote to Syd. Not feeling too well, a Bad cold. No news of that money yet. orders to day. Planes up again to night dropping bombs on Hazebruk. deffered pay £30.5.0
Entry.19: church Parades, lovely morning, letter writing day. Letters from Nell & Syd Post Card from Tony. in their new house at 70 Bridge Rd Camperdown & not too pleased by the tone of the letter. Wrote & posted letters to Nell, Syd, Jack, Tony, Carol. deferred pay £30.6.0
Entry.20:
beautiful morning, Cold night, Taubes dropping Bombs again last night & flying over us here. Terrible Bombardment all night, must have been a great Battle.

deferred pay £30.7.0 Taubes dropped bombs on Melville killing 20 & wounded 130 Ausy’s.
Entry.21:
lovely morning again, Cold at night Blanket & great coat not enough & this is summer how will I possibly get through another winter Some of the Towns near here Everingham, Baringham, St Omer, Hazelbrouk, Melville, Estaires, Thinnes, 

30-8-0
Entry.22: Been very hot as hot as any day yet in France but still it gets cold at night Fritz did not come over last night bombing. We are advancing every day now this morning at about 7.30 a great Bombardment was going on have heard that we advanced another 7 kilos. if this fine weather lasts the huns will out of Belgium in a month. Letter from Viv to day. Wrote out Will & had it witnessed by Jack Bennett A. Coy. & Jim Jewell D. Coy. Posted it to Perpetual Trustee Coy Sydney. 30-9-0
Entry.23:
Hottest night in france since we have been here Taubes over again last night search lights galore. like rain to day, several showers & very heavy clouds about 5. p.m. am feeling grand & getting fat Beer 1 ½ d a glass. Good news. Italians taken 13.000 Prisoners French 6.000

30-10-0
Entry.24: cold, windy & like rain Winter not far off now wrote to Viv & Syd. still at Lynde & no word when we go yet. Italians here taken 13.000 french 6116 & British about 5,000. Wrote Post Cards to Nell, Jack, Tony, & Carol also to Loo, Will & Clive. Cold wind blowing all day as cold as winter tonight. £30-11-0
Entry.25:
Would have been Mothers Birthday to day. nearly two years ago she died. Not quite so cold to day but the winter is coming on fast.

No Taubes last night. A lot of Officers & N.C.Os gone to schools so I may get my other stripe any time now. About time. A rumour that men 40 & over do not go into the line anymore and a lot being sent home. £30-12-0
Entry.26: deferred pay 30-13-0. church Parade, like rain nothing important. Rain started about 8.30 came down in torrents, out in it till 9.15. Rumoured great Victories for the Allies. wrote to Trustee Coy. Also Syd appointing him Executor of my Will. Posted them.
Entry.27:
fine but like rain again, rained nearly all night. very cold last night Winter coming quick. wrote yesterday for £15-0-0. Letter from Nell & Jack also Trustee Coy yesterday. going to Rain again 2 p.m. have not got my other stripe yet.

raining all the afternoon & going to all night very cold & miserable thank goodness we are not in the Trenches. defer£30.14.0
Entry.28:
A fearful night last night & again to day a gale blowing breaking off limbs of trees & showers of rain every now & then. Great Country this. To night is the night fritzs threatened to bomb this place to pieces seeing how the weather is think he’ll postpone it. Route March abandoned. gale has taken up a bit 6. pm. & time too. Fritz might come after all.

deferred £30-15-0
Entry.29: Genrl Haigh inspects today, windy, Raining & cold. fritz did not come over last night. C. Coy. won competition against all comers. 55th win nearly all they go in for some Bat this. Italians going great guns. Also French & Tommies All Ausy’s out of the line. deferred £30-16-0
Entry.30:
deferred £30.17.0 expect my other stripe to night. Pay day tomorrow, I may not get any. Gale still blowing & Raining every now & then Wrote to Nell Jack, Tony & Carol P. Cds. yesterday.

Thursday continued

Just been through gas test. helmet O.K. some of the men very frightened, but after Noriel when fritz sent us gas shells from 9 pm. till 6. am. didn’t affect me much. That was some gassing. The huns Bombed St Omer the other night killed & wounded a lot of civilians.
Entry.31: deferred pay £30-18-0. getting my other stripe tomorrow, Pay to day, raining like hell as usual, leaving here next week, wrote to Viv & Trustee Coy telling them of my Promotion. Boys got pretty merry Pay night
Entry.32: got my stripe up also bad head, did not get paid yet havent anything to draw anyway. Route March to day. Sports on Monday. Band played in the square two nights ago, if it wasn’t for what is in front of us one could really enjoy himself, but its difficult to forget what one has gone through. Posted letters to Nell, Jack, Tony, Carol, Viv & Trustee Coy. Raining again The crops will rot if we get much more of it being congratulated on all sides to day the old man seems rather popular all at once. getting pay at 4 p.m. deferred pay £30-19-6. Paid 10 francs 7/4 Ye Gods. & £200 in the Bank. overdrawn in Book £8-9-7. cant Pay off my debts 65 francs
Entry.33:
Raining like hell, church Parade, all sorts of rumours about where we are going to. 

Plenty of drinks about Riot up at B Coys Estaminet Principally A Coy. men 2 of them in clink over it smashed windows & bottles etc. fine cold night Taubes up.

deferred. £31.1.0
Entry.34:
Fritz got busy last night dropping Bombs & firing 15" shells all over the place. Got out of the shed into the open. dropped 14 Bombs on Hazebrouk & blew up the gas works. 7 bombs on Reneskue & some on St Omer. one 15" shell fell about 400 yds from this place also 2 others went & saw the hole this morning fully 20 ft deep & about 30 ft round. must be firing them from 20 to 25 miles away. Knocked off about 1.30 a.m. Brave men these huns frightened to come over in the day time prefer to murder women & children at night time the scum.

deferred pay. £31.2.6. Been a beautiful day. & looks like another clear night so can expect fritz again, found an aireil Torpedo dud this morning but still think the holes were made by gun fire. 54th D. Coy had narrow escape Torpedo fell 4 feet outside their Billet blowing off the roof one man had his head cut open. Concert tonight.
Entry.35: a beautiful morning like yesterday Concert finished quickly last night Fritz over again Bombing St Omer Melville, Renesque, Hazebrouck etc. left us alone. did not stay up too long too sleepy & tired, he kept at it all night The moon is only just going down 9.30 a.m. deferred pay. £31.4.0. Sports this afternoon. Sports went off splendid, General Hobbs & staff etc were there & he told us we should soon be in the thick of it suppose Fritz will be over again tonight
Entry.36:
5/9/7

lovely day. Bat dinner last night all the Knuts there Tres wis-Bang. bad head to day. too many friendlies, never mind, we’ll soon be in it again as the Genrs said & few will come out of it.

Rumour says Riga fallen good enough for the Russians there half German anyhow.

deferred pay £31.5.6
Entry.37: two years to day since I went into camp wonder when it will finish. Great Bombardment all last night & still on, 11.30 a.m. Thunderstorm last night looks like more rain. deferred Pay. £31.7.0 moving in a day or so. Terrific Thunderstorm again this evening been muggy all day Bombardment still on no planes to night.
Entry.38: Friday, hazy, muggy weather more rain about.Bombardment stopped for a few hours couldn’t see but started again 10. a.m. just as bad deferred pay. £31.8.6. Very hot wrote to Maude no more letters from Ausey or Viv either getting 4/6 per day now instead of 1/- started on the 31st so that to date have £1-16-0 to knock off a/c of £8-9-0
Entry.39: heavy fog hear we are not going in till the 26thdeferred pay £31-10-0. Bombardment stopped last night too foggy to shoot. Doing ½ an hour’s drill every day now. last concert tonight foggy again.
Entry.40: a lovely day cleared up nicely last night Guns started again in different sector Kept at it all night church Parades this morning The last here I suppose deferred pay £31-11-6. 4 p.m. this is about the most perfect day I have seen in France
Entry.41:
10/9/7

cloudy, Foggy morning but fine day & nice Breeze still no word when moving deferred pay £31-13-0

C.Os Orders to day (5.)
Entry.42: Beautiful Morning, cold night, only up twice last night generally 4 times. guns going it like mad not far off. Plenty of Planes up. Baby buried this morning 7 months old died from shock when that shell burst near us, about a week ago. Inspection by C.O. this morning, Deferred pay £31.14.6. Very Hot 10. a.m. Day finished fine.
Entry.43:
Cloudy & cold, North wind blowing Papers full of Russian Civil War & Swedens funny business, how is it all going to end, France without a Parliament too. 

Going into the line Sunday or Monday worst place we have been to so they tell us.

deferred pay. £31-16-0.
Entry.44:
gloomy & going to Rain. Cold all day yesterday, but wind dropped last night Sergeants had a Beano last night 20 of 32nd Sergts invited to dinner had a good time Not arf. had to stay on guard over the Marquee all night lot of drink about.

off duty to day. getting Photos taken to day. letters from Syd. Nell. Jack. Tony. Viv & Trustee Coy. deferred Pay £31-17.6. rumours strong that we are going Egypt after this stunt. Wrote to Nell & Syd.
Entry.45: Pay day to day. Cold wild night better to day though very much like Rain. Not feeling too good yet. deferred pay £31-19-0. writing to the Boys to day. can see Cassell from here. also a lot of Big Towns scenery is splendid a little way out Wrote to Tony. Paid 10 francs 7/4 Boys very drunk to night but no rows amount owing £5-6-11.
Entry.46:
rained a little early this morning but fine now with heavy clouds. Boys on a stunt to day. deferred Pay £32.0.6. letter from Maude. Wrote reply also sent letter to Tony.Bat. had a sniff of the hun gas today. so that they shall know it when they meet it. One of the Sergeants from Head Quarters demonstrating had frightful blister on his chest through a drop of it getting on his handkerchief which he put in his breast pocket also got our Photos taken Maude sent me Minnies & Alex’ photos.

turned out a beautiful day. Amt owing £5-2-5
Entry.47:
lovey day & very Hot. off Tomorrow morning early about 10 or 12 miles dont fancy the march at all after this long spell, not so many drunks about last night

deferred Pay £32-2.0 Amt owing £4-17-11
Entry.48:
We’re off at last. up at 5.30 BKs. 6.30. fell in ¼ to 8 started fine with sun hot & red one hour after cold wind heavy clouds & misty rain. What a climate. going 10 miles deferred Pay £32.3.6 Amt owing £4-13-5 arrived Poperinghe at 4-30 p.m. about 13 miles & nearly all on stone cobbles Oh my poor feet.

are now in Belgium & going another 10 miles tomorrow.
Entry.49:
Fine & cool, slept like a dead man stiff & sore feet this morning & just starting on another 10 mile march steel Helmets on at that 46 of the 30th got knocked out on their march the other day by a hun Plane. deferred Pay £32.5.0. Amt owing £4-8-11 got here at 1-15 started about 9. feet nearly dropping off living under Tarpaulin hung on a wire

Wednesday 19/917

Made a mistake two days ago, only came into Belgium yesterday The place we were at was Steeningvoort, this is near Poperinghe. Last night there was a terrible barrage put up by our guns the flashes being like lightening & almost blinding to watch a lot of fritzs must have gone out. Staying here a couple of days & then into it According to accounts this is the worst place of the lot & the key to the Postion. Only about 18 miles from the sea. deferred pay £32.6.6. Amt owing £4-4-5. We came through Steenbruck & passed Cassell & are about 6 miles in Belgium now Aircraft simply swarm here brought one of Fritzs down this morning guns going like hell at one now 4. p.m. (Abeele, Rienehurst,) came through Abeele Reinehurst on our right about ¾ of a mile Poperinghe on our left about 2 miles
Entry.50:
off to the front in half an hour Big Bombardment all night all along the line

Rained like hell during the night but did not get wet, all is bustle & getting ready slight rain falling now. up at 5.30 deferred Pay £32.8.0 Owe £3-19-11.

Have not gone yet 12 noon been standing to ever since 2nd Divy went over last night & must have been successful or else we should have gone before this Huge shells fall every now & then near this place. Went on to a hill & watched Bombardment last night, it was awful & as far as you could see in a half circle.

News a bit better in yesterdays paper. Lots of wounded taken by here to the Railway.

Still here 4 p.m. 184 Hun Prisoners just come in & 400 more to follow 1st Ausy Division took them this morning at 5. a.m.
Entry.51: nice morning, but cold night windy & Raining slightly. Hun Planes Bombed all night about this place but did not come near us. His High Velocity guns send Huge shells into the adjacent Village. No sleep all night. In two nights 15,000 Prisoners have been taken 2 or 3 Generals amongst them & still coming in
Entry.52: Divy must have taken close on a 5000. Huns very degected seem to think its all over with them & they look a miserable lot. Moving off today full marching order deferred Pay £32-9-6 owe £3-15.5. letter from Viv yesterday. off in half an hour about 2 ½ miles 12.30.1 officer & 4 men of ours took 60 German Prisoners last night. might not go after all no further orders through yet. 1.30 pm. off at last 6 p.m. destination not known said to be about 3 miles.
Entry.53:
Arrived here (camp) about 10 pm. After fatiguing march of about 9 or 10 miles with full pack up mine weighed about 80 lbs. with 120 Rounds of ammunition.

Air craft guns machine guns & search lights by the score on the road Just over our head 2 hun Planes they dropped Bombs on the Town we came through & set one big house ablaze. Guns everywhere, fine morning & cold night Guns going it strong & shells bursting on ridge about 5 miles away Am sitting down watching it all. Fritz has got the wind up properly & our fellows are giving him hell. Moving off again to the Line at 1 oclock deferred Pay £32-11-0 Owe £3-10-11. not going up the line till about 5 p.m. now. Boys went into the line about 5.30 I am one of the lucky ones going back to Transport & cookers to look after Guard there
Entry.54: Glorious morning up at 6. Mounted the guard last night this is a huge camp. & often gets bombed by Taubes. All quiet last night. A Taube attacked one of our Baloons near here but the two men jumped out & escaped per parachute The night before fritz got one of our Baloons set it on fire, both men jumped out in time but one poor fellow’s parachute failed to act & - furious artillery firing all night & still on Planes are fighting just near us & things are lively The Boys go over tomorrow morning. deferred pay £32.12.6 owe £3.6.5. letters from Nell & Jack. eight of our Boys killed up to the present dont know how many wounded Bombardment started again like fury lights out at 8 Taubes up.
Entry.55:
heavy fog this morning Bombardment again at 3. a.m. Our Boys have gone over but no news yet wrote to Nell, Jack, Viv & Syd Sent Syd all the letters that the Trustee Coy sent me for safe keeping. deferred pay £32-14-0 Owe £3-1-11 Our chaps did not go over some more killed & wounded coming out to half way house tonight in again Tomorrow night & over next morning. Got my letters away The Padre censored them, feel easier in my mind now that is settled. 

Am having a bully time this time the only things to be careful of are Taubes & high Velocity’s. Have washed every thing 3 Prs Sox. 2 shirts. Handkerchief (Jacks). Feet. etc etc. feel quite clean The usual Bombardment started about 7.30.
Entry.56: Another beautiful morning yesterday was as hot as you get it in Sydney in November & to day promises the same. Moon getting brighter so must expect fritz over every night now. The usual Bombardment early this morning either the British went over or Fritz came across. No news from our Boys yet. One of my men came back yesterday says its pretty hot up there. deferred Pay £32.15.6 Owe £2.16.5 no news from Trustee Coy. Forgot to mention that we are in the Vicinity of Hooge, Ypres, St Julien etc. Fritz is up over head & our guns are firing at him, he is so high its almost impossible to see him with the naked eye. Been very Hot again to day. Boys going over in the morning & all along the line. Aircraft very busy also aircraft guns. Thick haze to night.
Entry.57:
The 55th went over this morning but do not know how they got on Bombardment started at 5.30 Poor old Amos Williams one of my men on guard at Hooge dump was wounded his mate was killed last night. There are two 16" guns close to here & they shake the soul case out of you when they fire they have been going all the morning wouldn’t like to be where those shells are falling Expect we will move back some time to day. deferred Pay £32-17-0 Owe £2-11-11. cloudy morning but going to be fine & hot. Been fine all day but heavy clouds about & Rain. Boys went over & had great Victory 800 Prisoners by 12 noon Killed twice as many a lot of ours killed & wounded Capts Cotterill & Marshall wounded Boys says it was real sport potting the huns like rabbits as they ran from shell hole to hole The guns have been going all day but are now quiet 5. p.m. Seem to think we will break through their line here, if so the end is nearer.

Just going to bed 10.30 p.m.

Boys still up in the shell holes Lieutenants Pye, Tarn, Porteous wounded Sergts Cook 

& McRae killed both two good fellows feel very sorry for them also Frank Walker A.M.C. Fritz counter attacked with the 3rd & 4th Guards tonight but no good. 57 first splashed them out then the 56th the same later on.
Entry.58:
Sergt Jenkins woke me up at 5 to warn all men for the line, wanted as stretcher bearers. huns Counter attacked all night, but did not get through We have lost a lot more men. One lot gone up & another standing by to go if wanted. Boys coming out to night.Deferred Pay £32.18.6. Owe £2-7-5. Slight rain this morning but fine now. Ltnts Colliers Stafford Marine wounded Poor Paddy Mitchell killed shot through the head steel Helmet no good. (Pioneer) he was one of the lot who took up rations 
yesterday
 to day. The huns came over in their Planes tonight & dropped Bombs all over the place hundreds of them, there seemed to be no anti air craft guns about & they did as they liked talk about London being defensless & this is the front line & everything depends on the Push. Makes one sick these English why dont they go & smash up the hun. Times, They will when a Cabinet minister gets blown sky High or some one a bit above him does. The Bombs made an awful noise being very large One Plane flew up the Road & dropped four one after the other, don’t know what damage they did but it must have been considerable. Away up towards the coast there seemed to be a large fire burning when I went to bed at 12 oclock. Our boys up to 8 p.m. had had six counter attacks. They have lost about 250 so far. glorious night nearly full moon
Entry.59:
Hadn’t been in bed long when the Artillery opened up & kept going till early this morning no news from the front yet. Party went out yesterday bringing the dead, had an awful time they tell me. Today is a lovely day not a cloud in the sky & beautifully fresh. deferred Pay £33-0-0 owe £2-2-11

The huns bombed us again tonight & they were huge at that big as a 9 point 2. shell. don’t know what damage he did. Boys still in the line been up there a week today. fritz shells us also with H.V. gun got pretty close to day. Going to bed 11 p.m. 

Dicky Hilliard wounded again. C Company nearly wiped out.
Entry.60: up at 7. Fritz greeted me with 2 of his huge Bombs in the road way, what an infernal row they do make. The road to the front is a perfect shambles. dead men, mules, horses, smashed & burnt motor waggons crumpled up aeroplanes, limbers smashed to bits when is it all going to end. he is sending his big shells over again. Poor Ernie Allen has joined the rest. cloudy & misty, like rain. deferred Pay £33.1-6 Owe £1-17-5 Towns or Villages I have come through lately. Hazebruck. Lynde, Renescure, Blasingham, Wallon, Staple, skirted Cassel, Steenvoorde, (skirted Poperinghe, (Belgium) passed through Dickebush, Oudendon, Reninghelst, Ypres.) 15 months ago was in Thiennes, then on to Merville, Estaires, Sailly, Bac-St Maur, Laventie, Fleurbaix, Neuf, Outtersteene, Bailleul, Pont Remy. then the Somme. The Poor Old Padre Capt Hunter of Redfern was killed last night shot through the head a good old Friend who will be missed he censored my letter for me. going to bed 12 midnight fritz been bombing us for the last 3 ½ hours seems to be getting desperate put up a big counter attack but our Barrage sent him back it was terrific.
Entry.61:
A lovely morning but cold night touch of frost guns been at it all day yesterday & night & still going like hell. must be a big hop over tonight or Tomorrow

morning. how anything can live on the other side beats creation. The Taubes came back again last night & dropped tons of more Bombs. night at 7. our casualties were 151 not so bad seeing the Boys have been in that hell a week. they come out tonight deferred Pay £33-3-0 Owe £1-12-11. clock goes back an hour tonight. 45 in three days time. Shifted camp about 5 and just as well, fritz came over in swarms & Bombed every & anything where our Marquee was & where we stood guard is now a crater he dropped one of his largest Bombs right on the spot & we would have all been blown to atoms & it was only a fluke we left that camp as up to the last there was no other camp to go to. The Boys came out at about 11 p.m. about 250 short. a short rest then in again moving farther back to
day
 morrow.
Entry.62:
at 5 this morning a terrific Barrage was put up on Fritz make up for some of the damage he did last night Big fog on but has lifted now 8.a.m. got to bed about 1 this morning but little sleep fritz’s planes too busy. Deferred Pay £33.4.6 Owe £1.8.5 leaving here after dinner. Still here 5 pm going Tomorrow 

Fritz not so busy tonight at least not so round here. They went farther back.
Entry.63:
off this morning about 5 miles back to the Previous camp, very hot day, Feet very tired glad to get here & away from the awful din of guns & Bombs. They dropped Bombs here the other night. deferred pay £33-6-0 Owe £1-3-11. getting to bed early tonight The scene of our hop over was Pologon Wood (famous)

Telegrams of congratulation from Birdwood, Plummer Prince of Wales & the King.
Entry.64: My Birthday 45 to day. have to go to Poperinghe & take train to St Omer to bring back 3 Prisoners. Rained last night got wet Fritz dropped a lot of Bombs near us altho we are another five miles back, going to be fine to day. deferred Pay £33-7-6. Owe 19/5 Payday to day. In Poperinghe there are 1 cathedral & 3 other large & fine churches Next big Town to this is Abeele then Goort Van - Hazebruck, Ebblinghem, St Omer, fine big town this St Omer have to stay here all night, was bombed the other night 4 Hospitals wrecked men & Nurses killed have seen them, one hospital hasn’t a room intact & there are hundreds of ruins. The swine. going back tomorrow 11 Train got to bed at 9 in wet Blankets that had just come out of the fumigator nice way they treat escorts luckily they will keep out the wind it is raining.
Entry.65: Raining & miserable not exactly cold yet but its getting close to winter now & I suppose the summer has gone. The Huns did not Bomb us last night too wet. Going Back this morning with Prisoners deferred Pay £33-9-0 Owe
Entry.66:
left Prison at 9.30 to catch Train at 11. Left St Omer about 2 got to Hazelbrouk at 3.30 had to get out & catch Train at 4.30 for Poperinghe Got here about 6.15

One of the Prisoners was I believe a Tommy deserter masquerading in our uniform had to watch him all the way as he told one of the other fellows he was going to skip. Got him here alright. Wet & cold all day but clearing up to night
Entry.67: Cold wind blowing & more rain about Just saw over a 1000 hun Prisoners go past. Any amount of Hospital Trains yesterday deferred Pay. £33.10.6 Owe. 10/5. Paid this morning 30 francs. 22/- Paid Davis 10 francs
Entry.68:
Bal owing to him £1-0-8. Owe now to Pay Master 29/11. COs orders. 3 p.m. rained hard at 12 noon fine now but like more rain. 1700 german prisoners marched through this morning guns going it hard. Raining like billy-ho 7. p.m. guns booming all the same

more fritz’s came in this afternoon ought to be a lot more tomorrow letters from Mrs Parsons & Will Stewart. Must write Tomorrow for Xmas Mail.
Entry.69:
lovely time last night getting lights out it rained in torrents & made this land of mud like glass two of us came down with a bang & got covered in mud. Pat cleared out & got drunk came home about 10 nearly broke my toes getting over me, a little after he spewed it all up just outside the tent & to finish up pissed himself once more and out he goes. A Cold wet miserable night & ditto to day

Deferred Pay £33-12-0. Owe 25/5. & 20/8 to Parkes A beast of a day shivering in our tent all day.

Sunday. 7/10/17

frost this morning fine at first but now cloudy & a cold wind blowing,

Gothas over, bombing all round here last night. A H.V. gun set off a dump not far away great explosion. No sleep. deferred Pay. £33-13-6. owe 20/11.

Going up the line again in a day or so fearful night again everywhere a sea of mud

Monday 8/10/17

off this morning up to the line fine but cold wind blowing, no Taubes last night too rough but H.V. Gun. shelling Poperinghe. This cursed place is worse than the Somme.

deferred Pay £33-15.0. owe 16/5. going up in reserves in place of 3rd division

letters from Syd & Viv answered both Posted letters to Maude & Nell.

Kept fine till 4. p.m. now raining hard but we are in huts here so it doesn’t matter so much. may go further Tomorrow This is the Ottawa Camp. Addendum. this camp we have a big stove & its red hot what a difference from the last there in laid not in tents just a hang over a Tarpauline over a wire & the rain beating in all the time. This doesn’t seem like war at all.

(Battle of Broodsinde) (Polygon Wood Ausys.)
Entry.70:
A fearful night last night almost a hurrican blowing & Rain with it what an awful time the Boys in the trenches must have had. Not much better this morning only that the rain has stopped for a bit. do not think we move to day. This Place is Oodendum. Too wild last night for Gothas. deferred Pay £33-16.6. owe 11/11. been fine all day but cold wind blowing dzs of our Planes up this evening something doing again tonight Tommies went over this morning & gained all objectives. The Tanks cost £8000 each & weigh 27 Tons.

Wednesday 10/10/17

The Huns were over us again last night counted 110 Bombs dropped near here.

Cold night but fine & now cold but spitting rain deferred Pay £33-18-0 Owe 7/5raining hard 12 noon. Guns going it Posted letters to Syd & Viv yesterday. Rum issue last night & tonight nearly forgot what it tastes like

Thursday 11/10/17

Cold night but no Gothas too cloudy & wild, heavy Bombardment all night getting intense this morning would not be on fritz’s side for quids, fine this morning but more rain hanging round deferred Pay £33-19-6. Owe. 2/11. been a nice day wind a bit nippy. Heavy clouds on the horizon. Big push tonight Ausy’s 8th Brigade, New Zlds & Canadians. A Big Party of ours going as stretcher bearers.

Friday 12/10/17

off to Boulogne for a Prisoner to day go to Poperinghe first. dull morning & cold our Boys 4th & 5th div went over early this morng took all objectives. A lot of wounded coming back got to Poperinghe about 9.30 missed Train have to stay here till tomorrow’s 9 oclock Train deferred pay. £34-1-0 out of debt now coming to me 1/7.
Entry.71:
up at 6 Had a bad nights rest in rest camp Poperinghe, chats by the million, about 300 of us Jocks, N.Z.s Tommies South Africans etc. got to station at 8 to catch 9-27 Train to Boulogne am now in Train & not started yet 10. a.m. Wild night last wind & rain, Sun shining this morning but not for long by the look of things.

deferred Pay £34.2.6. owing to me 6/1 Rain all the way am now at Cologne Got to Boulogne at ¼ past 7. Cold etc. Am now at Barracks & going to bed 10.30.
Entry.72:
Sunday in Boulogne out seeing the sights, good rest last night 4 Blankets Could not get Prisoner too late so going back tonight 12.30 fine morning. deferred Pay £34-4-0 – 10/7 have had good time went over the old fortress to day about 1000 years old going back at 12.30 tonight. drew 15 francs to day 11/- dinner cost me 10 francs. Roast Beef, Potatoes

Beans, Bott Stout, Bread & fresh Butter. The Boys down here Tommies, Canadians, Scotties, Ausy’s NZs etc. treat you fine plenty of ale. 9-30 got Prisoner from Barracks off to Train at 10-15 to catch 12-30.
Entry.73:
had a good night only the three of us in one compartment 2nd class at that slept nearly all the way. Just passed St Omer 7. am.

deferred Pay. £34.5.6. owe
Entry.74: a fine day at last. am at the camp at last 1 p.m. near Ypres only ½ mile from what was once a beautiful city now heaps of Bricks & mortar. Will go & look at it in a day or so as it is famous. Looks like more rain & all we have over us is a small Tarpauline The ground is quite wet so am in for a nice time tonight. Only one Blanket.
Entry.75: Put in the coldest time yet last night ground all wet underneath & the shelter such as it was draughty add to that Black frost & keen cold wind, my feet were like lumps of ice in the morning have sent for my other Blankets. The Gothas were over last night dropping bombs all over the place, none just here. Guns going all night they are just near us so no sleep. Fine morning hope it keeps up. deferred Pay. £34.7.0 –
Entry.76: Its one continual Bang here, can see Ypres clearer this morning nothing but ruins all of it letters of Viv & West Aus. Agent Genrl office
Entry.77:
Nice morning but cold wind however its fine rained a little during the night.

Wrote to Newton.Guns never stop all day & night fritz sent some heavy stuff over near here last night too cloudy & stormy for the Gothas last night.

deferred Pay £34-8-6. –
Entry.78:
Saw a thrilling sight just now one of Fritz’s Planes brought down by ours when

about 7,000 feet up one of the airmen either fell out or jumped out. The Plane was on fire. Both men & Plane were smashed up one man was jammed up in the plane. An awful death. We all rushed to see them, but it got too far so turned back some of the others went to see them.
Entry.79:
Some heavy shelling last night on both sides some of fritzs H.V. stuff came unpleasantly near. Rained heavily also but got no water in our shack. A Beautiful morning this morning, clear sky & the sun warm. deferred £34-10-0 owe me 17/7 Posted letter to Newton yesterday. Ought to be going out on Sunday.

Dinner time still a lovely day, hope it keeps fine for the rest of the week
Entry.80: Gothas over last night dropping Bombs counted 17 close to us. & during the night there was a great artillery duel & a hop over two shells landed just over our shelter mighty close. fine night & morning again but cold & cloudy more rain coming, hope we get out of this before it does, deferred Pay pound;34.11-6. owe me 22/1 another Belgium Town I was through, (Goewaersvelde) & Caestra, Cologne, Wimereaux. Audruico. Furioses storm. Hail & Rain & great Bombardment.
Entry.81:
A lovely morning like spring but every where mud from yesterdays storm the Artillery duel lasted all night & was the greatest yet since we came here.

deferred Pay £34.13-0. – 26/7. Yesterdays storm was a corker at 1-30 it was as dark as at 5 oclock then the lightening & thunder got to work the thunder drowned the roar of the guns & between them kicked up hell, first came a deluge of rain then Hail. The hail fell so thick that you could pick it up in hands full an hour afterwards. The ground had just begun to dry up but now it’s all a mud hole & so it goes on every day. Kept fine all day. expect the Taubes over to night. Our Boys coming out tomorrow.
Entry.82:
lovely morning again.

Taubes came over last night & again this morning about 6 oclock, but dropped their eggs away from here. Terrible gun fire again all night. deferred Pay. £34.14.6. – 31/1 leaving here this afternoon going about 1 mile for tonight then further out. Got here about 3.30. good camp but nearly all tents about 5.30 Fritz came over & dropped Bombs all round here some only a hundred yards away made an awful din don’t know what damage he did. Expect to leave here Tomorrow.
Entry.83: terrific Barrage put up this morning about 6 our side must have gone over. Rained hard all the time fritz counter attacked about 8 oclock all quiet now & getting fine. deferred Pay £34.16.0 35/7 the camp is called "dickeybush New Camp."
Entry.84: Raining & miserable nothing but mud. No bombs last night altho it was a clear night. Our rum issue helps to keep us warm lot of the boys get terrible colds Dont know what our movements are expect to do two more days in support then out for 6 weeks. deferred pay £34-17-6 – 40/1 letters from Syd, Mrs Parsons & Viv. Paid to day 50 francs Paid Parkes 20 francs owe him 6/- now Paid Jack 5 francs settled with him Paid canteen up. Now owe 25 francs. to Jim, Amos & Pat then finish.
Entry.85:
lovely morning but cold & heavy clouds coming up rained during the night also a shower of hail-stones guns been at it all night & still going strong. The huns Zeps came a cropper good luck to us. deferred Pay £34-19-0 owe me 7/11

leaving here tomorrow farther back. to reorganise. Paid Amos 5 francs settled.

had a bath first for about 3 months got new singlet & underpants, clean shirt feel quite light.
Entry.86: an awful night, a howling gale & rain cold enough for snow. up at 6 Bks at 7.30 off to Abiele 8 or 9 miles. Got here about 11.30 not so bad as I thought fearfully cold so I suppose that had something to do with it. Gale still blowing had bath yesterday & good job too else my feet would have given out. dont think much of this camp. in tents with wooden floors. deferred Pay. £35.0.6. – 12/5.
Entry.87:
Taubes over here last night can we ever get away from these things & we are out for a rest. Bombs dropped on the railway & roads that is it seemed so.

Rained all night, not so cold today. deferred £35.2.0 16/11. Raining now & will do all day. this place a muck hole. 3 p.m. Details & Reinforcements came in raining hard had to stand out in it for more than an hour fixing them up.

Some of the tents like pig stys boys wouldn’t sleep in them walked into village to try & get beds. disgraceful way to treat men of Polygon Wood. Brigadier can’t sing their praises enough Said 14th Brigade was as good as anything that ever walked & this is how they treat them after. Truly we are only food for canon.

Got fine about 6 p.m.
Entry.88:
Cold night & fine. Bombed again by fritz but the guns kept him away from here.

its a lovely morning Cold with keen wind from the east if it lasts may get some fine weather The boys in the front line must be having hell.deferred pay. £35-3-6 – 21/5 off to Caestre for Prisoner 9 am Caught Train at 1-20 am in it now 2 p.m. got to Caestra but no prisoner there so had to come back after walking about 10 miles got home tired & hungry away all day.
Entry.89: fine morning but getting cloudy & Cold first frost of the year Italians got a great set back 30,000 prisoners taken & 300 guns We are doing alright, but general opinion is that it will take another 2 or 3 years to finish the war. deferred Pay £35-5-0. – 25/11. 2. p.m. Just saw sad sight whilst on duty. We are camped near the Canadian Hospital all marques or tents & alongside is a large grave yard 8,000 in it & today 80 more were buried there saw them also ambulances rushing up full of wounded etc. How long will the country stand it. & there hundreds of such places. got home from duty 9. p.m. A fracas occurred between a Canadian & Belgian the Belge stabbed the Canadian who is in a serious condition (cause woman).
Entry.90:
lovely morning & no frost rain keeping off well great bombardment all night. Have to do 2 hours drill to day wonder whats in their bonnet getting us at drill.

deferred Pay £35-6-6 – 34/5.

Patricia Camp B. BDE HQ. L29. A.8.9. our camp.

Posted letters to Syd, Viv, Maude & Mrs Parsons letter from Viv

Raining 5 p.m. full moon
Entry.91:
Cold & gale blowing, cursed climate this; Paid to day, drill again this afternoon

deferred pay £35.8.0 – 34/11. Perfect pig of a day. drill postponed. 

Pat gone to Cassel & back again with prisoner going on duty at 1.30 am. to 7. this job getting no good. cleared up for awhile
Entry.92: a lovely morning & fine full moon night. The huns were over bombing round here dropped more than a hundred & kicked up hell was on duty when he started a bit of schrapnel fell with two yds of me. Paid to day 50 francs. £1-16-8 deferred Pay £35-9-6. Paid Jim 15 francs Pat 5 francs Parkes 8 francs 2d 6/- out of debt at last. Pay to day 39/5 Bal 2/11
Entry.93:
cloudy & like rain no two days alike. Concert at Poperinghe this afternoon for all the Batallion. deferred Pay. £35-11-0. Pay 7/5. fritz over again last night but driven back by aircraft guns after dropping a few bombs. They killed 2 & wounded 3 night before last, & it took over a hundred bombs to do it.

Italy looks like another Roumania & Serbia by the Papers on duty tonight till 1.30 a.m.
Entry.94: Cloudy, Misty but not cold tried to rain last night but did not last long, Italians getting a hell of a time, not going from here for some days now. deferred Pay £35.12-6. Pay 11/11. No Taubes over last night The Boys went to a concert at Poperinghe yesterday. Been down opposite the hospitals again awfully sad always processions of dead to the grave yard each covered with the Union Jack at the other end a processions of ambulances bringing in the wounded & on either side of each football being played up here the Bigade band is playing what a world it is death & suffering & agony alongside of football, drinking shops etc etc it makes one wonder. – on duty till 9.30 dark & misty & muddy.
Entry.95: cloudy & misty though not cold bath to day, nothing much doing, not feeling too well lately feel the rheumatism in my legs a lot. deferred Pay. £35-14.0 Pay 15/5. lent Pat 5 francs last night. Just got word 2 pm. that we are going back farther about 15 or 20 miles. had the miserables last night after watching this Poor chaps being taken to the grave yard a Tommy standing near me said "It’s hard, chum By God it’s hard" & his eyes were full, felt something like it myself. No letters from Nell or boys for 2 months.
Entry.96:
moved off this morning for Outterstein at 9. got here at about 2. p.m about 14 miles 

clean done up. my feet awful did another 3 miles looking for our packs. but did not get them so here we are no blankets or great coat & freezing Talk about a mess up, some of these heads ought to get theirs read

we were here twelve months ago on our way to the Somme. wonder if we are off there again

deferred Pay £35-15-6 – 19/11
Entry.97:
Put in a lovely night with only my waterproof sheet over me, luckily we had some straw under us or we should have had to walk about all night.

Got my pack with two blankets taken of it at 7 this morning, hope the swine who took them suffocates in them.

Fine with sun shining hope it keeps up.

came through Fletre

deferred Pay £35-17-0 – 24/5
Entry.98:
letters from Nell, Jack, Carol, Perpetual Trustee Coy yesterday. Cigarettes from Mrs Parsons 3 days ago.

Misty rain falling. Fritz shelling Bailleu 1 mile away Glad to be out of Belgium.

deferred Pay £35-18-6 – 28/9 turned out nice & fine at 4 p.m. for how long though The Planes are getting busy.
Entry.99:
Cold & horrible snow not far away trying to rain now so snow not far away.

Taking our steel Helmets & stacking them, must be going to get our winter clothing & time to. deferred Pay £36- – 33/3 Wrote to Viv & Nell, Jack & Carol Posted them
Entry.100:
frost last night, lovely morning, but not for long cloudy & cold 11 a.m. like snow 

nothing much to write about Got my Boots soled for the winter, deferred Pay. £36-1-6 – 37/9. Ought to get our sheepskin vests to day. On duty from 6 to 8.30 or 9 in the rain & cold wind & mud.
Entry.101: off tomorrow about 5 miles getting nearer the line again lovely morning, sun shining, but clouds blowing up. deferred Pay £36-3-0 – 42/3. our last night in Ooterstein fine but cold, on from 6 to 9. leaving at 9 for a 12 kilo Tramp.
Entry.102:
Off this morning to Locre about 12 kilos away. through Bailleul Wet, & heavy clouds looks like rain all day we are in for a nice march. Reville at 5.20. BKs 6.30 Blankets carried thank goodness. deferred Pay £36-4-6 – 46/9

got here Locre at 12. marched all the way in the Rain & wind very cold at first but soon got warm splendid camp best I’ve been in yet Huts with fire place in it & them & fires.

Going in tomorrow night. Raining like hell, Tea for dinner with what you brought with you Bread & cheese, BKs consisted of 1 small Piece of Bacon & Tea this is usual when you have a long march on. We are in Belgium again. letter from Viv. The guns are slamming away near here Ypres sector we are quite close to Dickey Bush.
Entry.103:
off again this morning; showery & I think it means rain all day, 6 kilos this time, Rained all night. Guns never stopped all day yesterday & night reports that Fritz is evacuating. deferred pay £36-6-0 51/3. Arrived here at about 11. The two blankets made a difference but otherwise feel alright. The sun is shining again but not for long. We are up amongst the guns now & an awful row they are making. This is just like the Somme last year & its nothing but a sea of mud & slush.

They tell me we are in for 6 weeks then out for 6 weeks & our Division is relieving 2 Tommy division. lights out at 6 p.m. Rain finished for awhile.
Entry.104:
Heavy frost last night, beautiful morning, Sun shining, (hot), no wind & no clouds best for months. & just like spring all the boys washing sox etc. etc. did likewise. Going in to the line tomorrow. deferred Pay £36-7-6. – 55/9.

Wrote to Viv yesterday havent Posted it yet. Posted letters to Viv. Perpetual, Jack & Carol 1 p.m. still a beautiful day wonder whats up with Belgium, Peace must be near surely to get this kind of weather. got letter from Trustee Coy same as last also Post Card from Jean, keeping fine thank goodness. guns going it.
Entry.105:
another nice day quite warm last night & also this morning too fine to last.

a Big Bombardment all night ending up in Terrific Barrage this morning at daylight & still going on 9. a.m. Not much sleep too much noise. Prisoners going away to day.

thank goodness glad to see the last of the malingerers. Pat going to Amiens for another Blighter named Price who is under sentence of 5 years but escaped.

Moving today but do not know where Staff & self are going.

The ground is getting a little firmer & would soon dry if the weather lasted.

deferred Pay £36-9-0 – 60/3. 84 francs. funny game this war here we are just near Pashendale Ridge & the guns roaring night & day & men getting killed every minute or so or wounded & just across from us is a 
Band
 
Practising
.

shifted to Day light Corner near Messines Ridge now or what is left of it nothing but shifting lately another one Tomorrow but not far.
Entry.106:
14/17

dense fog this morning the beautiful weather of the last two days couldn’t continue especially as the guns have been firing like mad for 4 or 5 days now if the hun is wining in Italy he’s certainly not doing so here. Moving again to day about 500 yds only. deferred pay. £36-10-6. – 64/9 fritz dropped two of his large bombs here the other morning killing one man & twelve horses just been looking at the holes about 10 ft deep & 30 ft Round "some bomb". Letter from Lucy also Syd.

fog lifted in the Afternoon. Am on night duty with my men 12 hours. Cookers stores water etc.
Entry.107:
15/11/7

Took my turn last last at 2. a.m. this morning till 6. fine night & with the help of a brazier kept warm had a rum issue. A lovely day to day on tonight from 10 to 2.

Writing to Syd & Loo & Jean to day. deferred pay. £36-12-0 – 69/3.

letters from Viv & Trustee Coy. same as last.
Entry.108:
16/11/7

On last night from 10 to 2. fine night but got hazy towards morning trying to rain today brought on by a Bombardment which started with a Barrage at 5 a.m. & going ever since 12 noon. Just spent my last franc No pay till end of month. 

deferred Pay. £36-13-6 – 73/9. wrote to Loo yesterday. letter from Maude 

on duty 6 to10 p.m. fine night guns going strong. borrowed 5 francs from Joe Dempsey.
Entry.109:
got fearful cold must see quack about it one of my men in temp Hospital one away after prisoner makes it hard on us three. Heavy fog this morning but clearing up sun shining like Ball of fire through it. Just washed under shirt, 2 prs sox, 2 handkerchiefs

This tent very damp altho we have brazier in all day. deferred pay. £36-15-0 – 78/3. another Ausy mail in no letters from Nell. on from 2 a.m. to 6. Foggy night.
Entry.110:
cloudy but fine still, wrote to Mr Carroll not posted yet.

Washed my shirt, sox, underpants & Towel, must stay in bed until they dry or go without. Pat got back to day 6 days away for one malingerer. Amos got three parcels any amount of letters & cakes now not even a letter from Nell & Kids.

deferred Pay. £36-16-6 – 82/9. Big battles every day. one started about 6.30 this morning one of Fritzs taubes came over this morning quite low but they couldn’t hit him. Later on they did get him & he got one of our Baloons. Not a shot being fired fritz must be evacuating.
Entry.111:
Still cloudy & warm, no rain now for nearly a fortnight ground beginning to dry up. On duty from 9. to 12 last night very quiet on all the front except the extreme left, this morning no guns are firing at all. Get our rum issue now at night. my cold much better. deferred pay. £36-18.0 – 87/3.

Posted letters to Loo, Syd, Viv & Mr Cassell. first letter I have written to the Old Man. On from 6 to 9. 3 hours shift now Pat has come back.
Entry.112:
Keeping cloudy but fine, heavy barrage on this morning at Paschendale Ridge or thereabouts. No pay for 20 days now 55 & 54 paid two days ago. deferred Pay £36-19-6 – 91/9. Borrowed 10 francs from Amos. Went to Divisional Pay Master to get some money couldn’t do it.

Went to Village called 
Demhoek
 Draunotre 2 kilos away nothing to see this night game is no good for torches, cost me 5 francs already for refills. 

looks like rain wind changed & Blowing hard, guns banging away.
Entry.113:
21/11/7.

rained like hell all night & a gale blowing all the time We put in a nice night on guard my shift from 3.a.m. to 7. hear that the 29th Divs has got Cambrai good luck to them. deferred Pay. £37-1-10 – 96/3.

got an order from Capt Gow for 2 new refills for my torch. Pat took Price to Anzac Compound got back at 9. the rest of us did 4 hour shifts mine from 6 to 10 p.m.

Scotch mist all day. Letter from Trustee Coy. same as last
Entry.114:
rain stopped but misty & like more rain

No Pay yet deferred pay. £37-2-6. – 100/9. ought to draw 200 francs this next Pay. No letters from Ausy. two more prisoners to go away today. They took 8000 prisoners near St Quentin or Cambrai. And Troops are 12 miles off Jerusalem also advanced 2 miles up here at Paschendale. only 3 miles from Cambrai now (Just come in) large mail in wonder if anything for me getting anxious have had lot of dreams about them. Wrote to Nell tonight but why I dont know 3 letters from her since July.
Entry.115:
23/1//17

Still misty, clear part of the night but got very heavy looking at midnight on from 9 to 12. Guns never stop. Amos gone to get paper with the latest news. This is the best camp at the front I have been in altho there is plenty of mud we have plenty of coke & our brazier is never out consequence is the tent is dry & we can toast our bread, food not too bad also. 
But
 the 
Rum
 is cut out. deferred Pay £37-4-0 – 105/3. or 143.39 francs. on from 6 pm. to 9.
Entry.116:
Gothas over last night bomb dropping first clear night for weeks. did not leave any here but not far away. Sooner be in the front line than have these infernal Bombs dropping near. change in the weather gale blowing & getting colder & heavy clouds still we have been very lucky so far this time last

year snowing & raining every day. Jim still sick. deferred Pay. £37-5-6 – 109/9. two letters from Nell one from Jack. Posted letters to Nell, Newton, Maude.

great gale Blowing nice night for duty on from 3 to 7. a.m.
Entry.117:
Been a terrible night gale became hurrican & wrecked a lot of canvas shelters.

couldn’t stand up against it. Went on at 3. Pitch dark. Boys coming out in a few days now.Deferred Pay. £37-7-0 114/3. cleared up this morning but wind hasn’t dropped much our Planes are up so suppose fritz will be over to night. on from 12 to 3. to night.
Entry.118: another bad night cold winds & rain like ice kept fritz away so it was not so bad, can stand any amount of cold in place of these 120 lbs Bombs of his. Very cold this morning with occassional showers of rain strong wind coming in gusts the winter is starting & we haven’t got our winter clothing yet last year we had them a month sooner. deferred Pay. £37-8-6 – 118/9 writing to Jack & Viv to day. Posted them Letters from Nell, Jack, Trustee Coy, Syd, Miss Byrne, cards from Mrs Parsons. On to night 9- to 12. getting very cold.
Entry.119:
Snow last night at 11-30 first we have had in Belgium bitterly cold on Post, Gale still blowing but raining & has been for hours. 14 out of A Coy skittled yesterday (1 killed. Ted Sharkey used to be with me at Melancourt. Sgt Mansell Tom Martin, Guy Mussett wounded fritz put a shell

into the Pill Box they were in it’s a wonder they were not all killed. The bad weather does not stop the guns. deferred pay. £37-10-0 – 123/3. Bombardment started early & was going strong at 12 midnight must be a fierce battle going on at Paschendale.
Entry.120: Kept fine all night though heavy clouds kept coming up. Guns been at it for hours, think it was about the fiercest gun duel I have listened to made your head ache & throb to hear it. Shifting to another camp to day not far away Boys coming out tonight. deferred Pay. £37-11-16. – 127/9.
Entry.121: Got to our new Camp alongside the road .Lindenhoek camp. had to put my men along to road to guide the boys in. finished at one this morning a fine night but very windy. Gun fire died down since yesterday morning rumour that the huns have evacuated about 30 kilos. A lovely morning good to be alive Pay tomorrow I hope -deferred Pay £37-13-0 – 132/3.Boys very pleased to be out last 2 killed 19 wounded 4 shell shock almost a record. Been on top of Belgium that is the highest Part of it obtained a grand view for miles could see the battle front for 20 or 30 miles along & see the guns firing, also Fritz’s Trains running, its a great resort for officers & soldiers hundreds up there today. Has been fortified by Fritz or the Belgiums & is surrounded by trenches & barbed wire. The Top is full of holes from shells & there is one bit of a building like a cage for wild animals Bears or something like that. feeling very crook to day had rum issue last night first time for over a week, no estaminets about here thank goodness
Entry.122:
Still keeping fine altho there was a slight drizzle all night. Boys had a holiday yesterday drill this morning.Pay day to day haven’t been paid for a month. deferred Pay. £37-14-6 – 136/9. This hill the highest in Belgium is Kemmel Hill it is now out of Bounds to all troops.

Raining again. Am told we are out for 10 weeks 2 here & 8 down near Boulogne. that will put us over February. Paid to day. 100 francs feel quite rich. Paid Amos 10 francs Newton 16-35 12/- cable Joe Dempsey 5 francs Posted letter to Miss Byrne.

3-15-4

136-9

73-4

 63.5
Entry.123:
Bitterly cold this morning can hardly write hands numb, getting P.O. Order for Newton Shifted out of dug-out yesterday am now with canteen. deferred Pay. £37-16-0 – 63/5. Not so much harmony amongst my staff as formerly. Lot of fellers drunk last night but no harm done. Weather keeping fine but snow very near,

Wrote & Posted letter to Nell Got one from Alice. Posted P.O.O. to Newton wrote to Alice. Cold intense
Entry.124:
gurrrr – snow this morning lying around & it isn’t cold not arf, but the sun is shining & the Boys have gone to Church, not so many drunks last night & we got a rum issue at 9 oclock. slept grand. deferred Pay. £37.17-6 – 67/11

going to snow tonight been an

awfully cold day worse than yesterday Bought a watch 15 francs 16-35 to Newton 10 to Amos 5 to Joe =46-35 cigs 2-50 sauce 1-5- Honey 2 milk 1-50 = 53-85 Towel 2-25 Lobster 2 francs Snowing a little 5.30 p.m.
Entry.125:
Wild night but no snow, very cold again this morning, had a blow out last night from England, green peas (tinned) fruit essence Cake, Plum Pudding, Beer.didn’t sleep a wink through it, indigestion. up at 7. Boys on fatigue.

deferred Pay £37-19-0 – 72/5. large mail in yesterday nothing for me.

Torch globe 1-25. soap 4 Blacking 6 Brush 1-25 Biscuits 1. Salmon. 2 Beer 1-50 do 1-75 Jove but its a freezer to day. Just saw eight of our flyers going over can’t understand how they stand it or fly it. milk 1-25 Beer 1-70 still very cold & clear.
Entry.126:
A lovely morning cold but clear & sun shining, Busy day had to go into Bailleul for 3 Prisoners 8 kilos did the 16 kilos in 2 ½ hours & walked all the way. C.O.s orders this afternoon Got Parcel from Comforts Fund Mrs 

2 shirts 2 sox 2 Hankerchiefs. laces, needles, darning wool, tobacco, awfully good of them & 2 grand letters. Bought milk 1-25 Herrings 1. fruit 1 Papers 1-30.

deferred Pay. £38-0-6 – 76/11
Entry.127:
deferred Pay £38.2.0 – 81/5 -white frost very severe everything icy freezing.

again 3 p.m. fritz’s Planes been very busy to day also ours counted 14 of our Baloons in one spot Paschendale be a big stench up there tonight.3 small Baloons came over from Fritz this afternoon seem to be dropping Papers or something some mystery about them C.O.s Orders again to day 4 up. Wrote to Mrs Colhamilton not Posted yet.
Entry.128:
Big frost again last night the ground is like iron now fritz was over again but not near us Big gun fire near Armentiers. a lovely morning clear & fine. deferred Pay £38-3-6. – 85/11 Wine 2.50. getting warmer so suppose rain is coming

Wrote to Dessie Dehms (Sox) & the Asst Sec. of Mrs Cole Hamilton’s
Entry.129: no frost this morning, Cloudy & like rain Boys on fatigue & drill. nothing much doing Fritz was over again last night reported that one of his planes was brought down. deferred Pay. £38-5-0 – 90/5. turning colder 12 noon am very lucky in this camp am living in the canteen with Cpl Siddons & Srng Williams both friends of mine & we have a good time together break up the boxes for a fire & have suppers last night Pork Sausages & Wine to night Pork chops. Sometimes we get fresh fish & salted Herrings. Anyway its a break to have a fire this weather. (Locre, Denoutre, Lindenhoek) Posted letters to Ladies from Y.S.C. fund. Wagga. Joe Dempsey lent me 20 francs bought underpants 8 francs. cake 1 biscuits 1
Entry.130: A lot of sleet last nigh the ground has thawed & is now mud again, misty weather this morning Great rumpus over horse lifting in Transport lines going to be some trouble for someone. deferred pay. £38-6-6. – 94/11 issued with Gloves to day. so getting our Winter stuff in scraps. Hazy tonight like rain
Entry.131: Rained all night & same to day church Parade, Inspection tomorrow cleaning up gear. deferred Pay £38-8-0 – 99/5.
Entry.132:
Inspection 9 to 12 went through cloud Gas etc etc. very cold but fine again letter from Com Bank fixing up £1- from Grace Bros good of them. 5 Gothas just gone over did not drop any Bombs here our guns kicked up hell but they got clean away. they are monsters. wrote to Viv & Comw Bank

deferred Pay. £38-9-6 – 103/11 fritz sends Baloons over now which drop Papers every ¼ of an hour telling all & sundry how he is wining & we loosing etc. seems to control them by wireless. guess its a sign of weakness on his part. Bitterly cold again after nice day.
Entry.133: fearfully cold this morning snow on the ground & cold wind blowing. fritzs heavy guns sending over 16" shells near us last night shook the huts as if they were made of feathers. Some of the lads gone out on Fatigue gurrrr – off to Boulogne in a couple of days for a month. deferred Pay £38-11-10 – 108/5 football this afternoon Battalion Team against rest of Batt. Voted this morning Yes. cold no name for it 6. p.m.
Entry.134:
Posted letters 2 to Viv one from Grace Bros 1 Manager Com Bank London Wrote to Mr Norrie. Much warmer this morning great artillery battle all night & still going on. I pity those poor chaps in the front line. off tomorrow about 10 for Samer

deferred Pay. £38-12-6. – 112/11
Entry.135: off this morning to catch Train left at 9 in Train at 1 off through Bailleul, Borre, Lumbre to desvines got here at 10-30 men drunk all over the Train speechless some of them got at some rum on the station at Lumbre. The swine got to bed about 11-30 out of danger zone at last. def £38-14-0 117/5
Entry.136: up at 7. BK fell in at rear of Bat & marched through Samer to here Hallingen 14 miles & what a march to finish up had to climb a mountain fully 2 miles long & steep all the way Just like Waterloo Range. Got here about 2 oclock done up, cold & miserable as it is an awful village the worst we have been in & they brought us about 100 miles to this, would sooner have stopped where we were. One Estaminet in the place & no store of any kind deferred £38-15-6 124/11
Entry.137: up at 8 no sleep last night too cold & windy awful billets, plenty for us to do here Picqueting the roads deferred Pay £38-17-0 – 128/5 ended up fine night but frosty & cold.
Entry.138:
cloudy again & like snow this is an awful place could not find worse if they went all over France & this is our Xmas home Boys sooner be in the trenches. We are on top of

a cold bleak mountain & all around us is similar nothing but hill climbing if you go only ¼ of a mile Snowing like hell 3.15 still snowing 5 everything white, cold wind blowing & all billets or Barns leaking Curse the fools who sent us here.

deferred Pay. £38-18-6. – 130/11
Entry.139:
Snow 6 inches deep every where a lovely sight but I like it better on the Pictures. The Hedges are simply beautiful but underfoot is slush cold wind blowing over the Bleak hills.

our Posy let the snow in so had to shift this morning got fine Quarters now warm & cosy got a double oak Bed myself with Matress & Bolster. wont know myself tonight. deferred Pay. £39-0-0. – 135/5 Pay tomorrow got two more men yesterday Bill Snoddy & Ham Bush sent 3 away to C & D. Coy. got 4 here counting myself. Only one Estaminet here & a good one at that Coffee & Cognac 4 Tres Bon. Still snowing 5 p.m. Starry night but cold & like snow, new Moon
Entry.140:
heavy frost last night Snow now frozen looks Beautiful but roads like glass, have to walk very wary or down you go. Orders this afternoon had to get out about 2 am to wee, cold, not arf. except for slight cold in the head am feeling OK. deferred Pay £39-1-6. – 139/11 fearfully cold all day heavy frost tonight. Everywhere white. Wrote to Syd & sender of cigs from Melbourne. & Posted them

very quiet. Rumour that I am to be evacuated good oh hope so
Entry.141: all the Country still white near the Hedges it is 5 & 6 ft. deep. Another heavy frost last night Kiddies skating on the Ponds. Fritz’s Planes up over Etaples guns firing at them, about 10 miles away. Expect to get paid to day. deferred £39-3-0 – 144/5 wrote to Maude Pay tomorrow. still very quiet but tomorrow night what.
Entry.142: Coldest day yet frost & fog fingers & ears nearly falling off Pay to day. might be able to buy something to get some warmth into us. deferred £39-4-6 148/11 Paid 100 francs 3-13-4 leaves 75/9Paid Jack 5 francs Erny Williams 5/- Siddons 5 francs = 18-7. Madam 5 francs = 23 francs. Bought shirt – 10 francs.
Entry.143: Another heavy frost last night this with a fog also has covered the Trees with frozen mist & they look beautiful but cold is no name for it No word from Australia yet nor Viv hope he is not coming over here. deferred Pay £39-6-0 – 81/1 like snow again to night low clouds flying & strong wind blowing Just as cold as ever, was there ever such to place to bring us to for Xmas My Pound from Grace Bros came through to day but have not got it yet. No Ausy Mail yet. last one 27 Nov.
Entry.144: deferred Pay. £39-7-6 – 85/7 still very cold & like more snow wrote to Viv Posting it today also Maude’s. No Ausy’s letters yet. guns booming in the channel must be submarines. or Archies.
Entry.145:
2 years ago today I left Ausy. seems like 200 Beautiful day Sun hot but keen Breeze blowing & big frost again last night Ground all ice & hard as iron.

deferred Pay £39-9-0 – 90/1 no mail or parcels yet Xmas seems to be a failure here Posted Maude’s & Viv’s letters to day.
Entry.146:
Cold & foggy hardly able to walk about ground so slippy just like glass.

Prospects for tomorrow rotten Xmas mail sunk both ways.

deferred Pay £39-10-6 – 94/6 came a lovely cropper this morning have to make up Wifes allotment of 4/- per day from Aug 30th last Puts me overdrawn £12-5-11 
more
 another instance of Brains in our fool Army. Seems that when you get 10/- per day you have to pay your wifes allotment & this should have been done when I got the 2 stripes on Aug 30th The consequence is it will take me till the end of April to pay it off & in the meantime I get 5 francs a Pay & after that 2/- a day or 40 francs a Pay my trip to England is about 12 months put off curse the damned Army & everything that sent me into it.

Have got 20 francs to do me till the end of Apl. Have since made it out & I find that if I draw nothing till the end of March I shall be in debt then 3/- nice to look forward to
Entry.147:
Xmas day fine & nearly all snow gone, much warmer, a little rain last night, ground getting very muddy owing to the Thaw setting in. The only Estaminet in the Village closed to all British Troops nice Xmas Present for us all

got a Pair of Sox & a Pocket Wallet no Parcels or mail of any kind. going to bed after dinner disgusted. deferred Pay. £39-12-0. had dinner Pork, Beef, Fowl & Plum Pudding not much of either. Very cold again, heavy clouds like snow
Entry.148:
Everything white again & snowing hard now 9. a.m. was up at 1 a.m. & the same then. Our delightful Xmas is over soon be in the Trenches again. Pay Sgt up again last night find I am £8-3-11 in debt at the end of this month which means Jan Feb & March to pay it off in the meantime I get nothing who wouldn’t be married & a cpl. deferred £39-13-6 will have it paid off By March the 23rd if I do not draw any in the meantime

Snowing like hell 11-45. a.m. about 7 inches now 1. p.m. & more to come everyone snowballing. Nearly a full moon & the sight is lovely been snowing again & expect it will all night. 8 p.m.
Entry.149: Snowed during the night & the country is just one white sheet its about 8 inches deep & alongside the ditches, Hedges etc its 6 feet deep a beautiful sight & not too cold this morning more snow falling now 10 am Boys out on Route March festivities or so called festivities are over & I don’t think it will be long before we move again. deferred Pay £39-15-0. 	Posting letters & Post Cards to Nell Jack Tony & Carol. to day. Posted them at Post Office
Entry.150:
fine & cold, frost, snow frozen as before nothing much doing having good rest here & expect to be here another fortnight then to Belgium again I suppose.

deferred Pay. £39-16-6. Bitterly cold night more snow coming "What a Place for a Rest".
Entry.151:
more snow last night & heavy frost very cold this morning but lovely & fine with sun shining The snow will be here now until it rains. being all frozen

deferred Pay. £39-18-0.
Entry.152: very cold to day grey sky & trying to rain but it means more snow, none last night The civillians tell me it snows up to April Pleasant place to live in. deferred Pay £39-19-6. Company sports tomorrow Batallion Tuesday I think no Ausy mail yet. Been looking after Canteen all the afternoon. The only place where I feel the cold most is in the hands & fingers they feel as if they were going to drop off. feet dont get cold.
Entry.153:
Similar to yesterday a bit of a thaw in makes it very slippery to walk about all the ground being covered now with Ice. Pay day to day. deferred £40-1-0.

Wrote & Posted letters to Syd & Nell Post Cards to Jack Carol & Tony.

been looking after Canteen all day from 10 am. now 9-30 pm. Concert to night & tomorrow sports etc & feed up. Boys merry tonight soon got through a cask of Beer too cold for me.

Owe £9-5-0
Entry.154: & this is New Year, sharp frost last night, Cold wind blowing nips your ears & fingers. Called up last night by Estaminet People One of our Beer sinkers trying to get into Pub. not to be found when we got out. So saw the Old Year out & New one in after all but it was hellish cold. Paid to day 30 francs being the Pound Grace Bros sent me & part of the 5 francs due. have 47 francs to do me 3 months Had a Pie, some custard & 1 cake each to night for Tea dinner Bully, Pickles & Vegetables. enjoyed it more than Xmas turn out.
Entry.155:
Begun the New Year well Burnt down a building last night where the QM Stores were damage about £2000 all hands called out but we stayed here in case anything happened here Officers were having Banquet at the time & lovely & mellow they were got same before finishing 1-30 a.m. Been pretty dicky all day got through Bott of Cognac & 2 stouts also sundry other drinks but its once in 2 years so not so bad

deferred Pay £40-4-0 Owe
Entry.156:
not feeling too good this morning Eye getting painful. too much Cognac.

Wrote to Syd today deferred Pay £40-5-6 Went to see fire this morning, Snowed last night & again this morning but the sun was shining & quite warm. feel anyhow to day feel as if I am breaking up. stiff all over & have to be careful how I walk or over I go.

wish the cursed war would end so that I could get back to the sun again its worse than an existence here. 3 weeks here today another 3 weeks of it would drive me Balmy.
Entry.157:
big frost last night very cold this morning letter from Viv last night wrote to him Posted letter to Syd this morning American Genrl here to inspect this morning

Posted letter to Viv. Ausy Mail in today at last may hear something of them in Sydney. Pat gone to Boulogne today Bill Snoddy tomorrow. feeling a bit better today, Cognac no. Bon.
Entry.158:
cloudy, dull & raw no frost last night feeling much better to day.

1 year ago today Uncle George died & will not fixed up yet.

deferred Pay £40-8-6. Bill Snoddy gone to Boulogne to day. C.Os Orders at 3 p.m. Owe £8-15-0 9. p.m. had great night plenty of Beer etc & whiskey by the S.M. Must keep your spirits up. Mail in & nothing for me so whats the use of worrying they dont worry about me will send for £50 out of that Legacy May as well have some of it as leave it to those who don’t care a dam whether I’m alive or dead, good mind to leave it to disabled Soldiers. They would appreciate it any way.
Entry.159: Heavy frost last night beautiful designs on the windows. Owe £8-13-0 deferred Pay. £40-10-0. Mail to day came up cloudy after dinner Raining hard tonight in Canteen nearly all day serving
Entry.160:
Much warmer snow all going but the roads covered with ice yet. Going down to Canteen again to daydeferred Pay £40-11-6 Owe £8-11-0.

Plenty of Beer last night no letters dont expect any now & wont write till I get some. Cold & miserable with the snow melting & the ground like glass hope it keeps up till all the ice is gone. feeling better to day & would feel much more so if I could hear from those Lawyers. Leave nearly due & not a Penny to go to London with. Talk of Peace terms etc hope it comes off. Got letters from Syd, Nell, & Jack replied will post tomorrow Just got home 11 p.m. Beer Whiskey. Etc. but sober
Entry.161:
Snow & more snow about 6 inches fell during the night & its a wild day strong wind & snow with it. Very cold. Just been out in it its worse than I thought fully a foot deep & a gale Blowing sending the snow in clouds over everything just like a fog this is the worst fall we have seen in france. Hurry up with that Peace. deferred Pay £40-13-0 Owe £8-9-0 Wrote to Mrs Parsons 

fearfully cold. Boys scraping snow off roads all day.
Entry.162:
Cold awful heavy snow storm this afternoon snow nearly 2 foot deep More clearing of the roads. Can’t leave your gloves off for long. going to snow all night don’t know what it will

be like if this sort of thing keeps up. deferred Pay £40-14-6 Owe £8-7-0 Posted letters to Syd, Nell & Jack. A lot of fellows getting sick here can’t stand the intense cold wonder how long I will.
Entry.163:
Snow melting fast tremendous thaw set in last night & all yesterdays snow has melted away But the ice underneath is still here & its the devil trying to walk.

deferred Pay £40-14-6 Owe £8-7-0

Boys off to Blighty on leave every day don’t expect I shall get away for another 12 months. Posted letter to Mrs Parsons. not so cold today all the designs gone off the windows. Sports on this afternoon & Tomorrow is Brigade sports.
Entry.164: Snow nearly all gone, same old wind blowing & much warmer every where slush & mud for a change. Wrote to Nell last night. Sports to day. deferred Pay. £40-16-0 Owe £8-5-0 a little rain but not much still warm 8.30 pm
Entry.165: Still keeping mild but I think going to rain. Sports next Saturday leave here about 27th for -------- Another letter from Nell also Jack, Carol, & Tony yesterday. will write to day. deferred Pay £40-17-6 Owe £8-3-0
Entry.166:
lovely morning sunny & frosty a little ice on the ground. Got clean change. Church Parade Wrote to Maude, Nell & Mr McLoughlin deferred £40-19-0 owe £8-1-0. Wrote to 

Viv Nell Jack Tony & Carol Maude & Mr McLoughlin.

quite warm like a spring day
Entry.167:
last night was the first I have slept with my head out of the Blankets too warm.

this morning there is 4 inches of snow on the ground & the trees are smothered again What price such a climate. got all letters censored by Tub Mathews now Lieutenant & just back yesterday from Blighty

Posted them to day. also Parcel to Nell with Australias etc in. quite warm again & sun shining at intervals. Cold as it is this is a grand spell we are having & the Boys are looking fine & fit expect we shall be going to Belgium again in about 2 weeks. I am having good time doing nothing and all day to do it in.

deferred Pay £41-0-6. Owe £7-19-0
Entry.168:
Pay day to day but I draw nothing. Owe £7-17-0 deferred Pay. £41-2-0

was out at 2 a.m. Snow everywhere when I got up this morning not a sign of it slight rain during the night melted it all. Windy but not Cold. Pat going to Blighty to day luck beggar. The day turned out awful a Hurrican Blowing & Raining like hell also Thunder & lightening which means more snow what a country getting much colder.
Entry.169:
An awful night Rain & Gale, still going strong but not cold did not go to Canteen for first time last night & they had stout in too, d.-------- talk about a Brothel this morning though. Boys getting paid today. deferred £41-3-6 Owe £7-15-0.

letter from Viv yesterday. Plenty of Stout & Laager in canteen sore heads tomorrow quite mild again gale blew itself out cloudy & like snow very warm to night & getting clearer
Entry.170: Snowing again & getting colder lot of drunks about last night. nothing much doing deferred Pay £41-5-0 Owe £7-13-0. wrote to Viv Happy & hillarious time tonight not so many drunk to night.
Entry.171:
cloudy & warm like rain lot of fat heads this morning mine O.K. sports to day.

deferred Pay £41-6-6 Owe £7-11-10 Monsieur & I friends for life shouts every time he sees me gave him 11 dz instead of 8. Reg letter for me at Post must get it tomorrow I suppose its from Poor old Nell bless her. feel a bit squalmy. 

quite warm again tonight funny weather.
Entry.172: got letter from Nell with Pound £1- inside also one from Jack. Paid Joe Dempsey 20 francs out of debt at last except for £7-9-0 owe Government deferred £41-8-0 went down to see Jim he’s pretty bad & will have to go to Hospital. Writing to Nell (No 3). By the 31st of March will owe 9/- if I do not draw any money at all. the 55th won nearly everything at Brigade Boys very happy tonight so am I but not zig-zag all night when the Boys dont play up to bed 11-30
Entry.173: Must finish letter to Nell today been down to C & D. Coy. got C. Dore installed on the staff. feeling not O.K. this morning & not over the odds last night. lot of sore heads this morning deferred Pay. £41-9-6. owe £7-7-0 finished up at 11 pm. getting through the window.
Entry.174: still warm & cloudy, funny weather, had a few Stouts last night too heavy dopy this morning deferred Pay. £41-11-0 Owe £7-5-0 got letters from Trustee Coy & Mr Barker Solicitor also Grace Bros sending Sox. have written to Trustee & Mr Barker sending back my Will etc.
Entry.175:
have written to Trustee Coy, filled up Will & written to Mr Barker The Lawyer also Mrs Parsons, Syd, Nell, Grace Bros London & Viv sending them to day.

still mild & cloudy rained this morning still feeling not O.K. but will be alright today sent for £15- for leave money. deferred Pay £41-12-6 Owe £7-3-0. got all my letters away and got one from Viv answered that also & sent it. so at last am clear of letters. Raining all day though warm as it is hilly here theres not too much mud but the trenches must be awful. Boys all broke so everything quiet.Jack got back from Blighty today.
Entry.176:
Still keeping warm & cloudy with occasional showers. Orders on to day. deferred £41-14-0 Owe £7-1-0 things O.K. OCs orders to day all B. C. D men no A

wrote to Cady Grace bros
Entry.177: weather still the same, feeling well to day, had an expection this morning. This afternoon a Brigade March past Divisional General deferred Pay. £41-15-6 Owe £6-19-0 Borrowed 10/- off Jack. otherwise Broke.
