Quite like spring & the trees budding what a difference to last year this time when we were muffled up with sheep skins cardigans & great coats here ordinary clothing is quite enough in fact too much & at night 2 Blankets are enough without the coat. Posted letters to Cady & Jack. Nells last was No 3. Expect to leave next Tuesday & into front line on 31st to bed about 11 p.m. some drunks kept me up.
Entry.178:
Foggy, still warm, winter over I think or at least the worst of it, will soon know.

deferred Pay £41-17-0 Owe £6-17-0

Been a glorious day like spring in Ausy Sun quite hot & to night a lovely moon & no frost about. guns booming at Boulogne, Gothas. sounds like Peace. going into the line on 31st
Entry.179:
Anniversary day, hope I am home for the next. Thick fog again this morning so fine day I suppose. our time drawing close. deferred Pay £41-18-6. Owe £6-15-0. Noticed the Moon coming up over one hill as the Sun went down another & full moon at that may not see that again this year. dew thick on the grass 4.30 p.m fog did not lift till after 3.00 not much sun colder to day, felt it in my left hand

which was a bit frost bitten some time ago. Nothing but Peace talk going on & there does seem some chance of it at last. Heavy fog again to night came up in ten minutes & was that thick you couldnt see two yds away half an hour later it was gone, high wind came up
Entry.180: A lovely morning, no frost, sun shining quite hot. church Parade. deferred Pay £42- Owe £6-13-0 getting close to Trenches now Advanced guard gone to day, soon be amongst the Bombs etc. This is a glorious day & the Bees are out so spring is not far off Feeling happy to night got letter from Nell she got the £10- so got a letter accordingly. If only peace would come
Entry.181: off tonight about 2. a.m. lovely morning slight frost, Posted letter to Nell. deferred Pay £42-1-6. Owe £6-11-0. Its a glorious day & I think the winter is over off Tomorrow morning at 4 a.m. Train at Samer at 7. Back to Kemmel. or Lindenhoek. 8. p.m. Plenty of excitement thank goodness all the boys are broke or ----- The Band wakes us up at 2 a.m. gee whiz to catch a Train at 7-15 8 kilos away thats the stuff to win the war. will have to stand about in the frost till 4.30 before moving off. of then.
Entry.182:
up at 2 a.m. no BKs. off by moonlight at 3. a.m. to Samer intrain there at 7-15 came through following places. Wazernes, Arques, Renesque, Hazebruck. got here at about 1 p.m. quicker than the down Journey of 14 hours Are at present at Messines Camp dug-outs awful place all mud &

water, had plenty of Coffee & Cognac before leaving & did not feel the march much thought stiff. To Bed at 8.30. Cramps etc.
Entry.183:
heavy frost last night & cold. Kept me awake altho I was so tired & cramps helped a lot. lovely day sun hot but mud awful, going back to another Camp this afternoon Norfolk Camp. deferred Pay £42-4-6 Owe £6-7-0 

gazetted full Cpl. Mondays orders.
Entry.184:
31/1/8

Put in a fearful night last night after getting here about 4 p.m. found no provision made for shelter & was told to find a dug-out or something ended up in an old tumbled down one open at both ends & was nearly frozen, severe frost tried sleeping with Boots on but about 12 took them off & it was worse, only had one Blanket & shivered all night, feet that numbed couldn’t walk for ½ an hour after getting boots on am now in a hut with 4 men in charge of mens kits etc. & a fire. deferred Pay. £42-6-0 Owe £6-5-0
Entry.185: off to Paris on Escort Bill Snoddy with me am at Bailleul now been here since 11-30 Train goes 4.30 Now 3 p.m. all night Trip Had better sleep last night did not freeze like night before deferred Pay. £42-7-6 owe £6-3-0. got £1- from Joe Dempsey had to stay in Bailleul all night
Entry.186: Put in hell of a night no Blankets & in house with no windows nearly shivered to death. off this morning for Paris by 8-5 Train got to Calais & had to stay the day off Tonight by 7 Train. caught it & am in it
Entry.187:
Arrived Paris 6.30 am in the Buffet awaiting a cpl to show me to Provost apts. A long & weary journey can hardly keep my eyes open. Owe £5-19-0 deferred £42-10-6 been up Paris & I dont think, havent got a bed yet. 

Got Bed & BKs at YMCA 16 francs for two of us not hot oh no dinner 3 francs each no BKs. Yesterday Tea 2 francs 50 each must think this escort Business is one of the best but they dont get me any more. Couldnt draw a Penny either. Bath 1 franc
Entry.188:
up at 9. never slept like it in my life beautiful Bed & soft Pillows undressed for the first time since Blighty. lovely bath BKs. 1 Egg & spoon full of Bacon & chips Tea & B & Butter. Called for Prisoners at 12 in Train now 1 pm move off at 1-20. Paris a lovely city. Knocks london kite high would like a month here & the Ladies oh ------. Beautiful shops & the Pictures & Photos reviews wouldnt do in Sydney. Ausies quite a curiosity here saw where some of the Bombs were dropped on Sunday week. Pessan Beamont, Creill, Laigneville, Cleremont, St Just, Amiens, Doulens. Abbeville., Etaples, Boulogne, Calais, 1 am St Omer, Hazelbruk, Bailleul. 
got here
Entry.189:
Came through above Tours on our way back from Paris had splendid trip but little to eat 2 Biscuits & tin of Bully Beef between two for 48 hours. Got here about 8.15 this morning left Paris 1-15 yesterday afternoon Paid 10 francs letters from Nell Jack & Carol also Parcel with Tobac. & soap. deferred £42-13-6 owe £6-2-8. Sent

Post Cards to Nell Jack Carol Tony No 4. to bed at 8 sleepy yet.
Entry.190: rained slightly during the night & a bit cooler this morning, very quiet at the front not a gun sounding this morning. deferred £42-15-0 Owe £6-0-3.
Entry.191:
gale Blowing all night & still doing so a little rain & much cooler weather breaking up for the bad Reported that the huns broke through last night on the 8th Brigade front. No particulars yet. deferred pay £42-17-6 Owe £5-18-3.

Jack just back from Lilless with Prisoner. rained all day & still Blowing.
Entry.192: Still sprinkling & a little wind everywhere the old mud must finish my letters to day. deferred £42-19-0 Owe £5-16-3. Written to Syd. Nell, Maude, Viv, Miss Eason (Sox). Posted them.
Entry.193: Cold & windy still little rain, still quiet on the front. letters from Nell & Jack & Trustee Coy same old letter why the hell dont they stop writing till they have something to say. deferred £43-0-6 Owe £5-14-3.
Entry.194: Still a gale blowing but no too cold, fine rain with it 4 men off to Australia for 6 months leave lucky beggars wonder when my turn is coming some more off to Paris this day week was there myself. Wish I was again. deferred Pay £43-2-0. Owe £5-12-3.
Entry.195:
Big Bombardment on last night another Raid I suppose, had to leave my underpants off

the hairy brutes nearly drove me mad I suppose it means another cold but colds are better than itches gale still blowing but no rain ground drying up. Letter from Nell & Jack yesterday. writing to day. deferred Pay £43-3-6. Owe £5-10-3. Posted letters & cards to Nell Jack Carol & Tony. No 6. got Parcel from Grace Bros Sox again also Parcel from Nells Cousin Minnie Girdler Wind getting stronger.
Entry.196: Rained a bit during the night, wind gone down a bit misty rain this morning deferred Pay £43-5-0 Owe £5-8-3. wrote to Min Girdler (Cousin)
Entry.197: Rained during the night just as the ground was getting dry of course. Nothing doing on the front except a Raid two nights ago by the 3rd D. when the got 47 Prisoners & killed 100 huns. that’s the stuff to gie ’em Papers say Russia out of it now. seperate Peace etc dam good job, now we will get on with it. Gale Blown itself out & quite mild now deferred Pay £43-6-6 Owe. £5-6-3. got three Papers from Viv
Entry.198:
Pat came back last night also got the two Tailors here, have 8 in the Police now.

Rained all night, Posted letter to Minnie, Girdler deferred Pay £43-8-0 Owe £5-4-3 Where we hold the line now we have Prince Ruphrets dug-out an elaborate affair glass doors etc Electric light water laid on & so on they did things alright for themselves. Capt Gow gave me 1 ½ francs for Papers this morning. Start tomorrow.
Entry.199:
very cold night my feet cold for first time in bed, Black frost lot of gun fire during the night

Posted letters to Nell & Min & Post Cards to Jack Carol Tony & Nell No 7. deferred Pay £43-9-6 Owe £5-2-3. Pat & Bill gone on escort 2.p.m. very cold.
Entry.200: heavy frost last night, clear at last, had cold feet all night, couldn’t sleep, cant make it out had 3 Blankets & Top coat but no good deferred Pay £43-11-0 Owe £5-0-3 brought a hun Plane down this afternoon 3 men ut none killed, Ausie machine chased them down great glee here amongst the Boys. very cold all day.
Entry.201: Another frost last night but not so cold as Friday night Pat & Bill brought back Comfort & Mitchell Its a lovely morning sun getting quite Hot. Should be getting my leave shortly wish that money would arrive deferred Pay. £43-12-6 Owe £4-18-3. Paid 5 francs 3/8 Owe now £5-1-11 shot one of our own Planes down to day, firing at a Fritzer one of ours got in the way & had a wing shot off they dropped & had their bombs with them which went off when they hit Poor chaps.
Entry.202: heavy frost last night, Gothas over us for an hour last night no bombs here heavy Bombardment at times & especially this morning at 6, lovely morning Planes everywhere. Some of the Boys very drunk last night deferred Pay. £43-14-0 Owe £4-19-11. letters from Syd & Viv Went up Mt Kemmil this morning fine view guns by the hundred banging away.
Entry.203:
Still lovely weather heavy frosts at night & very cold in the morning, Gothas over again last night dropped some bombs close to here. One shot down up in the front line this morning Was up there this afternoon saw a Plane come down in flames but don’t know whose. pretty stiff walk from here. deferred pay. £43-15-6 Owe £4-17-11. Three fritz’s planes came down & one of ours.

got a rum issue.
Entry.204: Foggy & frost this morning. hardly a gun fired last night & no planes over, can’t make it out deferred pay. £43-17-0 Owe £4-15.11. Wrote & posted letters to Nell & Viv Post Cards to Nell Jack Tony & Carol. No 8.
Entry.205: Rained last night, Boys went into front line B.O.R. came down here had to go out & get in stuff after being in bed. A & B Coy’s packs came in also Busy all day deferred pay. £43-18-6 Owe. £4-13-11 Wind getting up strong.
Entry.206:
Gale with rain all night & still going strong 12 noon. very quiet on the front

deferred Pay. £44- Owe £4-11-11. strong wind & rain all day,

Boys got a shelling day before yesterday so far no casualties.
Entry.207:
Heavy Bombardment up Ypres way at 9 pm last night Counter-attacked at 3 a.m. & the guns still going it 9 a.m. Gale died down, cloudy & 

like rain 23rd & no peace, so the Bible readers who said 22nd finished war are out of it. deferred Pay £44-1-6 Owe £4-9-11.
Entry.208:
Cold raw morning, cloudy, Mr Gow owes me one Paper. All salvage stuff away to day. (18 Tins of fat to date) not much artillery fighting last night deferred Pay. £44-3-0 Owe £4-7-11 4 more tins of Fat. Total 22. 

Cpl Cooper got Range Finder
 

Cpl. Henry got do do
Entry.209: Raining & cold wind been doing so all night, fritz waking up, sending shells over pretty frequent deferred Pay £44-4-6 Owe £4-5-11. Capt Gow Paid 5 francs for Papers had 2 now to date. 6d owe him 14 papers. Turned fine again sun shining. Beautiful night full moon expect Jerry will be over.
Entry.210: Jerry was over early this morning but nothing doing here. frost this morning wrote to Syd two days ago wrote to Nell & Boys Post Cards to day. deferred Pay £44-6-0. Owe £4-3-11. Sgt. Durnville took Range finder 24th also Capt King.
Entry.211: cloudy & mild no frost gale Blown out, Big Bombardment 3 a.m. & 5.a.m. up to the present only 2 wounded in our Bat. Wrote to Mrs Parsons deferred Pay. £44-7-6. Owe £4-1-11. going for Bath to day. Amos off to Blighty tomorrow Curtin took Byke away.
Entry.212:
heavy rain & wind all night, fine but cloudy to day sleet fell this morning much colder, Amos gone on leave deferred pay £44-9-0. Owe £3-18-11.

letters from Viv & Syd wrote & posted one to Viv he is off to Aussie.

Snow storm 2 pm fine & warm 4 pm what a climate. heavy Bombardment 8 pm.
Entry.213: Heavy firing all night. up at 5 to get packs for men going to school. Heavy frost last night fine to day. deferred pay. £44-10-6 Owe £3-16-11 Wrote to Mrs Parsons two days ago, heavy sleet at 12 now sun shining 12.30. getting very cold
Entry.214: Bitterly cold just like Xmas time all water ice & it has been freezing all day 3 p.m. last night the huns came over 3 companies in 3 places but got blown to ribbons 59th took 6 prisoners 53rd one prisoner The Barrage was terrific & lasted an hour, have not heard anything like it since the Somme. deferred pay £44-12-0 owe £3-14-11. Just commencing to snow all white again 10th Bat. fell in lost 30 Prisoners R.S.M. & a Major.
Entry.215: Horibly cold, ground white, wind from N.E not much doing last night. our chaps raiding tonight. Plenty going on leave asked if I wanted to go this morning but of course no money. deferred Pay. £44-13-6 Owe £3-12-11. Very dark & cold night.
Entry.216:
Very cold again this morning more snow coming Raid successful took 3 Prisoners 2 of whom were killed on their way in by the huns one of ours killed

Smith out of the Transport don’t know the whole result yet. deferred Pay £44-15-0 Owe £3-10-11 Pay day to day. One of our chaps threw away his Rifle & took to the fritzs with his fists. they brought back a machine gun. one fritz gave Lt. Collis a smack on the jaw with his foot must have been some go. Dicky Hilliard wounded again twice in leg.
Entry.217:
Rained last night, heavy. Huns tried a Raid about 12.30 midnight but the artillery soon splashed that up.

Bombardment for 1 ½ hours pretty severe fritz has a nice chance of getting through here We are spread out from Armentieres to Ypres. Our crowd at Messines. fine this morning but cloudy. Colonel came back yesterday. No. off. Paid to day 5 francs deferred pay £44-16-6 Owe £3-12-7. nice & fine 3 pm. warm

wrote to Nell No 9.
Entry.218: Beautiful morning, small frost Bill Snoddy going on leave to day, all my men going, but Yours Truly can’t. Very little fighting last night along this front. deferred Pay. £44-18-0 Owe £3-10-7. lovely day like spring.
Entry.219: fine but cloudy & not cold no raids on our front last night. had some Beer last night first for 5 weeks. deferred Pay. £44-19-6. Owe £3-8-7. finished up a nice day a little colder in the evening.
Entry.220:
Raids all along the line last night Gas sent over by Huns 10th Bat caught it 60 casualties heavy artillery fighting all night, lovely morning fine & frosty.

deferred Pay. £45-1-0 Owe £3-6-7. letters from Nell & Jack & Viv. latter not gone to Aussie yet & may be sent back here after all

answered Nells letter (9) also Vivs
Entry.221: More raids last night & consequently heavy gun fire, a lot of it on our sector going on now 9 a.m. deferred Pay. £45.2.6 owe £3-4-7 glorious day, Posted letter to Nell. Hun Plane Brought down near us this morning the Aussie Airman too good for Bosche.
Entry.222: another Beautiful day. fritz sending over 12" shells not far from here they are Pets, wouldn’t like to be near him when he hits. Livingston came back yesterday & time too the damned malingerer. good enough for him. deferred Pay £45-4-0 Owe £3-2-7. a crowd going to Blighty today. letters from Nell (2) Jack (2) Tony. 1. quite hot to day. Just very quiet afternoon too quiet for my liking means something later on.
Entry.223: another glorious day. about 4 a.m. fritz opened up with terrific Barrage on our Right later we opened up on our left between them they kicked up a hell of a row fritz is still sending them over, big ones,9 more days to go for the 14 days leave, hopless for me. deferred Pay £45.5.6 Owe £3-0-7. letter from Viv better news this time he may get home after all. Plenty of excitement men back from Schools & Blighty.
Entry.224: lovely morning the usual raids last night wrote to Jack. letter from Viv deferred Pay. £45-7-0 Owe £2-18-7 wrote to Viv Posted letters Viv Jack Maude.
Entry.225:
Spring Morning going to be hot day. heavy Bombardment this morning Armentiers fritz shelling us out here H.V guns deferred Pay £45.8.6 Owe £2.16.7.

More chaps for leave Weather changed gale from the north getting very cold

Artillery very active all day. Put 3 shells not far from here 8 p.m. some of 2nd Bat Hit also Horses 18. Raid by 60th Bat tonight.
Entry.226:
cpl Taylor Blew in at 3.30 a.m. for his Pack just then the Bombardment started.

Rain set in & came down hard, yesterday everything drying up now all mud again. Much warmer this morning. deferred Pay £45-10-0 Owe £2-14-7 Wrote Post Cards home Posted guns going like the devil all day. Turning cold again frosty.
Entry.227: very lively night fritz sent some more shells over to the same place last night close to us. shook our hut up some. Artillery at it all night. Cold wind this morning, frost, but nice & fine deferred Pay. £45-11-6 £ owe 2-12-7. Inspection today. Another crowd off Blighty to day. C. D. B & A Coys 10 Rifles came in D coy. Rest camp men Sent all spare Rifles to Armourer
Entry.228:
Lovely morning sun hot. an awful night last night shelled during the night high explosive & H.E. shapnell We were nearly all sent west one Piece of schap. about 50 lbs weight landed two yds away from the hut had it come through would have cut a man in two. Bullets (schrap) all over the place picked some up between our hut & the next. started about 12 midnight got no sleep & was going to get out but it was hardly safe if he starts again to night will get out into a dug-out

We all had the wind up for some time as the shells 9" made such an awful report a double one at that however am alright again now & we are about 5 kilos from the line. Bailleul was shelled yesterday & 30 or 40 people killed or wounded

one of our Planes was hit by a fluke & blown to bits a dispatch Rider was blown to pieces one of his hands was picked up 200 yds away. glad when we get out of this

deferred Pay. £45-13-0 Owe £2-10-7. The Boys in the front line heard us getting shelled & wondered how we were getting on. Big smash on this front in a few day’s time.
Entry.229:
did not feel too comfortable last night Capt Gow told us to make for dug-outs if fritz started again. Went looking for one & found one that would hold 200 men a beauty, but did not have to use it as fritz gave some other camp a doing on our left.

This morning he sent over 4 H.E. on top of Mt Kemmel something doing to day 20 Planes went over just now looked fine. Another lot off to Blighty today & schools. Pay day. deferred Pay £45-14-6 Owe £2-8-7 Wrote Post Cards to N. J. C & A.
Entry.230: Lovely Morning, also last night not a bit cold, but looks like a change. thank goodness it was a quiet night as had a decent sleep. fritz’s guns were firing over us again this morning like this on to the Railway & into Lake Locre. Aircraft guns going it like blazes they do kick up a row. deferred Pay £45-16-0 owe £2-6-7. Shelling us again 1-30 p.m. dropped a dud a few yds away just now & shells still going over us Am tipping this place will be blown up yet also all camps in Range. Band Practising as usual Fritz’s H.V. gun trying to get one of our Baloons all day banging at it now 6. p.m.
Entry.231: Raining set in, looked like it last night. fritz shelled us again during the night & again this morning, nearly got a crowd on Kemmel Hill yesterday afternoon, unhealthy place that. have about another 10 days to put in here yet. deferred Pay. £45-17-6. Owe £2-4-7. Raining in torrents 2 p.m. frtiz’s shells still coming
Entry.232: Rained nearly all night, very thick this morning fog etc. getting cold. fritz still shells us out here can’t make out what he is after Our artillery does not answer Boys in the line going crook about the Artillery not supporting them seems strange when they ask for it & can’t get it, yesterday fritz sent 460 minnies on to us & the artillery was asked to reply but did not. deferred Pay £45-19-0 Owe £2-2-7.
Entry.233: fine morning, moonlight last night Gothas went overhead but did not drop any Bombs however the guns made up for that & we got no sleep, shelled all night some very close, sending mud all over hut. fierce fighting up at Ypres & on our sector during the night. fritz has been shelling us all the morning also My nerves are getting a bit frayed & if it goes on much longer don’t know how I’ll stand it. Terrible lot of our chaps been gassed & the Bat is getting weak. deferred Pay. £46-0-6 Owe £2-0-7. Sent Post Cards yesterday to Nell 2 Jack 2 Carol 2 Tony 2 No 11. The huns came over last night on the 29th Div but were cut to Pieces also on the 3rd div one Prisoner taken by us & none of them got back.
Entry.234:
Foggy Morning, but going to be fine fritz dropped two Bombs close to us last night one a dud rocked the hut like a cradle the same old shelling during the night but not so intense anyhow slept through

it, first sleep for 3 nights. He just put 3 silent shells near us its a strain on the nerves the sudden explosion & not hearing the shell coming. Have to screw up your courage to go out to the W.C. deferred Pay. £46-2-0 Owe. £1-18-7.

wrote to Syd.
Entry.235: lovely morning & splendid night plenty of gun fire again but fritz left us alone so had a decent sleep. 2nd in more than a week. great rumours about fritz coming over at Bullecourt & getting driven out again 20 divisions & Tanks so they say he came over with must have been awful slaughter. Thank goodness he’s taken that naval squirt away so does not annoy us as he did. sun very hot to day. deferred Pay. £46-3-6 owe £1-16-7. Xmas Comforts funds came today nice little box from Newcastle cigs. Tobac. sardines chewing gum, Butter scotch, cocoa, cig Holder. Handkerchief. Bailleul being shelled 800 casualties yesterday & last night out of bounds to all Troops a shell every 4 minutes 10 soldiers & 30 civilians killed so far.
Entry.236:
everywhere bustle getting ready to shift again evidently some truth in rumour at Bullecourt of 20,000 prisoners & 200 guns taken from us. another rumour we have taken 500,00 huns everyone excited, all leave stopped, some men brought back off the Boat as she was about to leave goodness knows when I’ll get mine now dam these lawyers.

This front is much quieter now, must have been awful slaughter down there

he came up with 23 divisions against 3 divisions of ours, but it cost him 10 divisions in dead & wounded. lovely morning again quite

hot like summer will be hell marching. deferred Pay. 46-5-0. Owe £1-14-7.

2 letters from Syd & 1 from Maude. off Tomorrow to Locre. not much of a place as they shell it more than here. I find that there were 40 divisions of huns came over no wonder they got 16,000 prisoners but what did it cost them
Entry.237:
Cold & cloudy big change. Up at 4 loading packs etc. off this afternoon to Renninghurst. about 14 kilos. fancy I’ll be pretty done up by the time I get there. 

News about the huns getting worse heard they are shelling Paris from 60 miles back 40 m.m. guns. deferred pay £46-6-6 owe £1-12-7. had best dinner since I joined the A.I.F. all leave cut out. my usual luck. Here I am stuck waiting with one man to load up Officers valises etc. 6 p.m. & 14 kilos to go after will get to destination some time Tomorrow Trying to rain & very cold. Still here 8-30.
Entry.238:
Limber turned up about 9. last night so had to turn to in the rain & load up then set off 14 kilos lucky got a ride or I don’t know what time we would have got here arrived at 11. p.m. The night before was up till 1-30 am. & up again at 4-30 so not too much sleep, came along a road running parallel to the front & the guns were spitting all along the line. Moving off again today to Patricia Camp. Letter from Nell last night. Wrote to Viv. deferred Pay. £46-8-0 Owe £1-10-7.

off again about 4 or 5 kilos have to wait behind like last night. Cold wind blowing

got here Patricia Lines Camp 3-30 p.m.
Entry.239:
off again to day by train from Abele to 
Somme.
 cold & miserable looks like heavy rain. not feeling too good, letter from Viv last night

Amos lent me £1- deferred pay. £46-9-6 Owe £1-8-7.

Cold as winter again all of us shivering, they took our sheepskins & gloves & left us one Blanket each have a lovely cold.
Entry.240: In train about 7. p.m. all night trip. got to Bondicourt-Pas at 8 a.m. out & BKs about 2 ½ hours after then on to here per Boot to Lovencourt about 10 miles feel stiff & tired, Raining & cold lovely war this. Passed a lot of Trenches being dug to fall back on. dont look too good deferred Pay £46-11-6 Owe £1-6-7
Entry.241: Rained all night terrible excitement expected to be pulled out at 3 a.m. but slept like a log till 7. clean done up. feeling a.1. to day got over the stiffness. have my men on Ammunition guard expect to leave here any moment, are on the left of Albert at present. deferred Pay £46-12-6. Owe £1-4-7. Trench digging going on all round us Thousands of men at it day & night. our chaps going further up tonight, Patrol. The huns still keep coming like this \ / in two columns of close formation & altho thousands are mown down still they come I wonder for how long. They are out of Albert now & Peronne, & the English, French & Americans are in Ostend. on duty till 9. closing estaminets lot of drunks about.
Entry.242: fine morning, fritz shelled us last night. Put one just the other side of the road an armour piercing shell went in about 20 ft. This place full of Ausies & Tommies. fritz has not got any farther so expect he has shot his bolt. Wrote to Nell & Boys Post Cards. On patrol duty all day with my staff deferred Pay £46-14-0 owe £1-2-7 off again to day God knows where. been standing by all afternoon to shift to Rubompre but so far no orders. 4 pm guns Booming not far from here
Entry.243:
Rained during the night, shelled again but not so close to us this time. Cannot get any news from the front all sorts of rumours about. deferred Pay £46-15-6 Owe £1-0-7. Posted Post Cards to Nell & Boys. Still standing to to move away at ½ hours notice. over 200 Hun Prisoners just went through Pleasant Sight.

Still here 6 p.m. can’t make it out.
Entry.244:
April fools day & Easter Monday this time last year was at Le Barque. Plenty of snow there, Taubes over early this morning but did not drop Bombs on us. latest reports that we are holding them everywhere. deferred Pay. £46-17-0 Owe 18/7.Expect to move out today. This Place is Louvencourt. Came through Authie.

Taube over just now but driven back by our guns. Our Planes are in great superiorty here as elsewhere. Posted letter & P. Cards to Nell & Boys 13.
Entry.245:
cloudy & like rain again, still here C Coy out on Patrol very quiet, not a gun to be heard. think the actual crisis is over. deferred pay £46-18-6 Owe 16/7.

COs orders 12 noon. Turned out beautiful day with hot sun, can hear the guns now 4 p.m. Big fight going on Albert way 8 p.m.
Entry.246:
yesterday anniversary of Doignese cloudy & like rain, no news of last nights fighting nothing doing so far. deferred Pay £47- Owe 14/7. more rain.

another heavy Bombardment on tonight.
Entry.247:
Rained all night & still doing so news in the paper better. think we have the hun stopped now. COs Orders yesterday. deferred Pay £47-1-6 Owe 12/7.

Wrote to Maude No word from Trustee Coy yet wrote to them 22/1/18. Ausie mail in no letters from any of my People how tired they must all be. The Highland Light Infantry & the Oxfords & Berkshires marched out this afternoon

Aschew, Lealvillers Duchatel Amiens Harissart Rubempre Pierregot
Entry.248: What a night last night got to sleep about 1 a.m. Reveille at 3. BKs 3-30 moved out at 4 marched about 3 miles then into Motor Waggons & through the Towns & Villages below about 30 kilos then our Bus broke down & we had to do 5 miles per Boot & here we are 4 p.m. at Daouw Guns going off behind us & Corbie just in front of us The Boys may go up to night 2nd Divy pushed them this morning so its our Turn now feel very tired & ready for bed. deferred Pay. £47-3-0 Owe 10/7.
Entry.249:
had good nights sleep tired out got to bed at 11 up at 3 a.m. 20 hours of it. Rain gone nice & fine again. Muster Roll. Boys went into the line last night. deferred pay £47-4-6 Owe 8/7 This Village was

left at a minutes notice & here are Cows & Calves Hens & chickens, furniture Bee hives etc etc. & not a civillian seems awful for people to have to flee leaving everything behind in one house we found a small organ. The French Padre is selling Vin & cider.

Corbie is likewise they took nothing with them, so much for the British army that can’t put up a fight & stop the bosche. The Colonials are the only ones to stand up to him. We expect fritz over either tonight or the morning & if he gets through (which I dont think) it means getting out of this higgery. saw ten hun planes brought down today one in flames. our Planes are like Bees here & have fritz licked hollow Raining hard a terrible night for the Boys. wonder what time the hun is coming over.
Entry.250: Rain stopped during the night & fritz didn’t come over fancy he has shot his bolt. The planes are out again. Must be giving him hell. Big fight on our right last night.deferred Pay £47-6-0 Owe 6/7. wrote to Nell Ham was sent back to day hit on the wrist with a nose cap. 4.5 not serious but very much swollen Had to send Jack to take his place Am doing 3 hours on duty myself tonight 9 to 12. Pretty quiet on our front tonight.
Entry.251:
Raining again altho a clear night. fritzs Taubes were over us for an hour last night but did not drop any Bombs. fierce artillery fighting started at 2 am & continued on & off till now 11 a.m. did not sleep an hour last night cold & too much noise. have not got my letters away yet deferred pay. £47-7-6 Owe 4/7

Posted letters to Syd, Maude, Viv £ Nell. (14). Raining off & on. must be lovely at the front.

Some of the Boys have come in with Rheumatism etc covered from Head to foot in mud, Just dug a bit of a hole for themselves & got into that one poor chap Dad Erskine must have dug too deep as it fell in on him & smothered him. Our chaps coming out to supports tomorrow night.
Entry.252:
heavy artillery fire twice early this morning shells fell pretty thick round here Col Maconchy killed last night our old Col now of the 54th Batt. off to get two Prisoners for C. Martial cases this afternoon. deferred Pay. £47-9-0 Owe 2/7. went to next Village for 2 Prisoners 5 kilos away right along the front under Schrapnell fire most of the way. No cigarettes & cant buy them got some this morning in next village 11c a PKt.

(Auvigny) (Blancy.)
Entry.253:
No Rain last night & not much artillery fire on our front but plenty of it further off. Col McC not killed but badly wounded. Big hop over tomorrow morning. 50 details just arrived every available man wanted. deferred Pay. £47-10-6 Owe 7d got my hair cut & wanted it too looked like Caruso. Wrote to Nell. A great Battle starts Tomorrow morning Ausies, French & Scotties with the Yankees in Support go over & there is sure to be an awful clash God knows how many will come back out of it & our movements are uncertain now on. The huns seem to know there is something in the wind & have been over here in their planes to day flying just over the houses. Its all excitement now but this time tomorrow I wonder what the tale will be.

Thursday 11/4/18

The stunt did not come off on our sector the French went over instead on our right expect our chaps will go over Tomorrow. The weather still rotten, Scotch mist.

Col Mac died yesterday was badly wounded not killed. deferred Pay £47.12-0. Owe me 1/5. Posted letter to Nell (15) Weather clearing up sun coming out 12-30 noon. Guns going like mad. Paid Jack 5 francs owe him 8.60. owe Amos 20/- Wrote to Viv.

Friday 12/4/18

Beautiful clear night & lovely morning, great fighting in the air yesterday evening but couldn’t bring fritz down so he unloaded his bombs. Same at dawn this morning. had to go on duty at 3 a.m. to 6. Amos crook. Took some Pills last night & feel better this morning deferred Pay £47-13-6 Owe me 3/5.

terrible fighting going on on our Right Just saw a fritz brought down he got one of ours this morning He’s shelling the Road we use getting the Range I suppose must be going to attack soon. One of his shells got the Bridge over the somme which is bad for us in case of Retreat. one of Fritz’s Balloons just came down on fire

Saturday 13/4/18

Am on duty 1 a.m. fritz dropping Bombs all round here just let loose about a dozen close. otherwise everything very quiet. deferred pay £47-15-0 Owe me 5/5.

Amos still ill. Bussy. had to go to this Village for Prisoner found he was in Village next to us Doave A P.M Sgt gave me a rum. ours cut out. good game I am on Am Cpl & do all the hard jobs myself in future nix. Handed Harcher over to Sgt Osborne. Loaded up & ready to get out, got the wind up most of them.

Sunday 14/4/18

Called at 3. a.m. to stand to, took off my Pants instead, turned out false alarm some Tommies here frightened of their own shadow some of them thats left of the 5th Army. Poor lot by the way these go on. Beastly weather misty & cold wind.

deferred pay £47-16-6. owe me. 7/5.
Entry.254: Still cloudy & cold, last night like winter. Boys must have had a rough time. 3 of ours killed 5 fritzs & 3 Prisoners. fairly quiet night. All the same ready to get out if fritz pushes in our right. deferred Pay £47-18-0 Owe
Entry.255: written to Syd Viv, Arthur, not Posted.
Entry.256:
fairly quiet night misty & cold. fine rain this morning & foggy. Fritz has made a push up north he’ll make too many pushes yet. deferred Pay £47-19-6. Owe me 11/5Wrote to Nell, Jack & Tony. Posted the lot Lieutenant Collins Joe killed this morning & 3 others.

Wednesday 17/4/18

Lt. Clarke & 4 others killed last night our little grave yard is begining to grow Poor little Robo was killed with Mr Collins blown to bits, shell got the lot in their sleep, was talking to the only survivor just now a big strong chap Bill Davis & he looks pretty queer on it miracle how he escaped, some of B. Coy killed since. We have been getting the poor chaps Packs out. Reported last night that Hindenburg was killed by a Bomb. Trying hard to rain again. deferred Pay £48-1-0. Owe me 13/5. No Pay since the 4th March. Terrible lot gassed to day in 54th & 53rd &
Entry.257: Brigade ours are alright & moving back tonight, raining.
Entry.258: Cold & misty looks like rain all day. over 700 gone out gassed. Where are the reinforcements coming from. deferred Pay £48-2-6 Owe
Entry.259: Cpl Box & Griffo of the Transport were amongst the killed. The crosses are increasing 19 of our killed five more to day. Cold & clearing.
Entry.260: Sharp frost last night, Cold wind & cloudy but going to be fine I think our Planes very busy. Up at 6.30 a.m. No news at present 8 a.m. deferred Pay £48-4-0 Owe me 17/5 grand country this snowing this morning & afternoon now clear cold frosty night. Hear 1st Divy have taken Bailleul again guns pounding away 150 yds from us 6" naval & they kick up hell. A lot more Details arrived to day. Think Fritz has changed his mind about coming over here.
Entry.261:
Beautiful morning, heavy white frost, Planes over us last night & guns shelling us this morning at 6.30. 1st Divy took Bailleul after the Tommies had run away from it great fighters these Tommies Poor look out for England with such defenders.

deferred Pay £48-5-6. Owe
Entry.262:
Its a treat to be able to sit out in the sun where I am facing the german lines can see our planes at work & fritz’s schrapnell bursting all round them Rumours that Italy is trying for seperate Peace. 

Got a rude awakening this evening fritz shelled us, the shells just going over our stables & getting into buildings on the other side of the street Poor Delaney killed, Jenkins foot cut off & some others minor wounds. Theres a battery of 6" guns just near & they were after them The fool Tommy Gunners the night before kept firing while the Taubes were right over head but what can you expect from such idiots. Later on we got it again & had to evacuate Village into some small outpost Trenches just dug to day.
Entry.263:
Put in a lovely night in the Trenches just dug & it has been raining for over a week ending up with Snow & sleet. got some straw luckily. Bombardment all night, very fierce at times don’t know if fritz came over or not if so he got hell.

heavy fog during the night Sun shining again & I am out in it trying to get warm.

deferred Pay. £48-7-0 Owe
Entry.264: Our Boys came out last night for 24 hours spell & a Bath nice place to bring them to for it they also camped out in the trenches Going in to reserves to night. Pay day to day. Sent service Cards to Nell, Syd, Loo, Mrs Parsons Trustee Coy.
Entry.265:
Boys went up again last night into reserves plenty of fritz’s Taubes over last night but much quieter here now Our Big Bombardment the other night was a gas one.

Paid 30 francs yesterday 22/- owe Jack 6.60 Amos 30/- deferred Pay. £48-8-6 owe me 1/5 Washed out my 2 shirts to day have not had a bath for 2 months.
Entry.266:
Heavy fighting on our left last night quiet on our sector fritz sent gas shells close to us this morning but nothing doing. Got a bad cold must go to AM.C. this morning

been raining during the night. deferred pay. £48-10-0 Owe me 3/7. Its amusing to watch the Horses & Mules when let out they are like youngsters just out of school & get up to all sorts of antics. Not feeling too good very bad cold made worse by sleeping out in the Trenches the other night. Letter from Maude Wrote to Trustee Coy not posted yet. 6 p.m. am out in the fields again fritz raining gas shells into the Village a hundred a minute. sound like bees means a couple of hours after he has finished before we can go back. The building are being knocked silly. Got back at 10-30 p.m. as gas Guard did first shift myself to 12-30.
Entry.267:
I was dreaming the Taubes were bombing us when rudely awakened to the effect that it was the Village being bombarded by gas & H.E. shells hadn’t much time to think about the matter it was get out 4. a.m. & then outside what a scene, Hell let loose was no name for it. To wake up & walk out into that would upset a good many & it put me out of my reckoning as to where the Trenches were & so I wandered about the fields for nearly a hour with shells bursting all round me 

I was lying most of the time in furrow I then got up & Tried to find the trench again but got caught in the barbed wire & had a nice time generally till I found it. one big shell fell about 15 yds off & nearly knocked me down by the concussion. When we left the billets had to leave Pack & Blankets, have just returned from getting them & where I was sleeping a shell had come through & buried all my things God only knows what would have happened if I had been there at the time certainly not writing this. Bye the way am writing this to the tune of the battle going on for Amiens but altho fritz got through on the Tommies he has been driven back again Its 10-45 am now & this battle has been going on since 5 the wounded are going by in Ambulances, Waggons, Limbers, & walking A lot of our chaps who were in the Village with me have gone out blind. Last night was the first time I have seen a Village intact bombarded & smashed up. I am not likely to forget Auverne. Still here 1.30 p.m. & nothing to eat since last night all food destroyed by gas. 4. oclock sent for to report to Daours to Cpt Gow 2 kilos Back shells still coming & Fritz advanced a little on Tommy front. Got here about ¼ to 5 dead beat Went to Div Canteen & got some Salmon & Bott of sauce etc 5 francs. Got dixie of Tea & now

feel better. Have been made Company Clerk to A Coy All coy clerks gassed, only 6 cooks left out of 16. one Q. Master out of 4. Adjutant & Padre also gone also Capt Gow & 3 of my men. Gee whiz things are moving if I can only hang on to this job will be sgt. soon. Have put gas Guard on & all details taken out of billets only 5 of us left here to look after things Our chaps going over in the morning.
Entry.268:
Am installed as clerk at a real desk not a Box as usual. Hope it means giving up Police for good. 83 fritz Prisoners just gone by saw 2 others awhile ago. this looks healthy.

Muggy morning & like rain Rained last night lightly. Nothing happened in this Town last night so had a good sleep. Took Valuables out of Amos’, Ham’s, & Bills packs deferred £48-13-0 Owe me. 7/7. 11 more fritzs gone by 48 more gone by 58 also 39 also said to be 1000 in all. Just moved another kilo back to some quarries expecting Village to be shelled. The Village we were shelled out of was Aubigny. Am in charge of all other clerks am Quarter Master, Sgt of Police & guard controller wonderful how useful they find me when a pinch is on & yet am only a cpl. Over 2000 fritzs taken & he came over on the 53rd & 54th but cut to pieces the fields being left full of his dead, Attacked again on the right this evening & got forward a little, being on high ground could see all the guns firing its a great sight to look at but hell to be in. dead tired so going to bed Am sleeping in an open shed got a roof anyhow & its starting to rain.
Entry.269: Cold wet drizzle this morning slept the clock round nearly. Am very busy thank goodness they sent a man in to take the Comp. clerks job, have been through the packs with the RSM dead & wounded. Am still Q. Master & Sgt of Police & handy man. deferred Pay £48-14-6 owe me 9/7. RSM. gone up the line again am now in charge of all hands gee whiz at this rate will be generalissimo soon. Am kept at it all the time. To Bed at 10 played out
Entry.270:
Jack brought some vin Rouge back with him yesterday & it has put new life into me As R.S.M. am signing chits etc. & am very busy Just got my ration statis in & hope to have a spell this afternoon. Fritz stood up to the Ausies last night with the Bayonette & some of our Boys have come out with nasty wounds. Can’t see how they are going to reinforce us this time must have lost a terrible lot

deferred pay £48-16-0. Owe me 11/7 Not feeling well at all fancy that I got more gas than I thought Wrote Post Cards to Nell & Boys got letter from Viv he is at Weymouth again. Cold, wet & miserable afternoon going to bed early.

Sunday 28/4/18 

Scotch mist & cold, can hardly speak gas got me alright hope its not going to be serious. deferred Pay £48-17-6. owe me 13/7. got Marshall & 8 men killed yesterday there will be few Ausies left at this rate. the
Entry.271: Brigade the cemetry at Aubigny. 72 Reinforcements arrived today. Throat very crook hard to speak at all. Germans got Kemmel Hill & Kemmel & close to Hazelbrouk. Cold & wet.
Entry.272:
Terrific gun fire nearly all night & all along the line must have been some hop overs. Rained

nearly all night with cold wind This somme seems to be the worst part of France.

No news yet. The Ausies are getting a terrible cutting up. will have to take us out soon or none will be left. This open sided shed of ours is very drafty can hardly speak this morning felt like choking during the night deferred Pay £48-19-0 Owe
Entry.273: our Planes are up today. been too wet for them. Wrote Post Cards to Nell & Boys. Pretty Quiet tonight.
Entry.274: cloudy as usual but not so cold my chest does not feel so tight this morning but voice nearly gone. Our chaps coming out into reserves tonight been in the line now 3 months. got to do this because of the tip & run Tommies, would never have believed it of them if I didn’t know for certain deferred Pay £49-0-6 Owe me 17/7. 2 letters from Syd & one from Mrs Parsons. Misty all day. awful weather, throat no better 6 p.m.
Entry.275: heavy Bombardment of enemy lines with heavy guns last night very little reply from Fritz. Still cold & misty. deferred Pay £49-2-0 Owe
Entry.276: Posted letters to Viv & Trustee cy.
Entry.277:
milder weather at last wind gone down sun trying to shine, heavy fighting on our extreme right The French are there its near Amiens. Am out man hunting trying to get 4 A.W.L.s who cleared out of the line, fine soldiers. deferred Pay £49-3-6 owe me 21/7. Our Battle on this front was at Villers Bretonneux that was the night I was gassed turned out very hot to day quite a treat after the wintry weather.

been to Lamotte after the malingerers but not there 10 kilos

saw some monster guns on the way. wrote to Nell
Entry.278: Beautiful morning nice Breeze sun hot. Big hop over this morning great Bombardment put up by us. no news yet. Letter from Amos & Bill Snoddy. they are at Etaples Hospital. deferred Pay £49-5-0 23/7. had a bath first for 3 months & wanted it Bad. The Baths are in a building that is built right over the River Somme so got plenty of water 3 fritz’s Planes down this morning. looks like rain again coming up letter from Viv he expects to get home in a few days now.
Entry.279: The Heavies gave fritz hell last night but brought on heavy Rain as well & as our roof has holes in it we got a shower Bath. Our Planes very busy on this front On our Right the French are always fighting deferred Pay. £49-6-6. 25/7 been man hunting again 4 of them A.W.L. & cowardice before the enemy. Turned out very hot again so more rain I suppose. Wrote some more to Nell not posted yet.
Entry.280: Raining but warm. Bombardment last night with our heavies brought in on. A Lot of men came out here to rest, crook feet, Trench fever etc. dreampt I was going home in five months with Lt Cohen. deferred Pay £49-8-0. 27/7. Am sending tin Box of little things to Nell. wonder if she got the other one. Heavy thunderstorm this afternoon & raining now 7 p.m. Weather should settle now Letter just arrived from Nell. Still Raining but looks like settling up.
Entry.281: dull morning, like more rain, muster Parade. deferred Pay £49-9-6 Owe me 29/7. wrote to Syd & Viv. nothing doing much.
Entry.282:
Rained all night & is doing so now, came through the tiles & dropped all over us, heavy Bombardment of fritz’s lines with gas etc guess he got a sweet dose & suppose he’ll return it. The Yanks are arriving on this front at last.

deferred Pay. £49-11-0 Owe me 31/7. wrote to Maude Been charged
Entry.283:
for cable sent from Egypt 11/4/16 when will the B finish charging me with something anyway it’s not me but Viv who sent Cable. leaves me 20/6 now. Turned out fine & hot Rumours that the hun is coming over Tomorrow morning, hope its not a repetition of Aubigny.

Wednesday. 8/5/18

fritz did not come over this morning as anticipated another one of his dates gone agly. did not rain last night but a lot of gun fire all night. cloudy but fine today.

deferred Pay. £49-12-6. owe me 22/6. Wrote to Mrs Parsons turned out fine & clear, cold wind blowing, guns very busy.

Thursday. 9/5/18

Beautiful Morning, old Frenchman here says Bon weather now, Yes for a couple of hours I suppose, getting very hot.

guns kept at it nearly all night its to prevent fritz massing I think anyway prevention is better than cure. deferred Pay £49-14-0 Owe me 24/6. wrote to Loo Posted Parcel to Nell & letters to Nell, Syd, Viv, Maude, Loo, Mrs Parsons & Amos Williams. thank goodness that is done been carrying them for weeks.

Friday 10/5/18

Fritz was over last night & this morning Bombing cool morning with heavy clouds & misty but think it is going to fine up The usual Artillery scrap all night

deferred Pay £49-15-6 Owe me 26/6 turned out fine again but not as hot as yesterday letters from Nells & Viv he is off to Aussie at last, has his name on the Boat list. Wrote & Posted letter to Viv
Entry.284: Cloudy Raw Morning, fritz dropping bombs on & around Daours this morning about 4 oclock. A lot of our chaps came out of the line & have gone back to Nucleus others from there are taking their place. deferred Pay. £49-17-0 Owe me 28/6 Paid 2/6 for that Parcel to Nell, been cold all day. got warmer about 4-30 but only for a little while Rumoured the 2nd & 4th Divisions are going over tonight.
Entry.285: Rained during the night & cold miserable morning Raining again now 11 a.m. more like winter than spring. deferred pay £49-18-6 Owe me 30/6. 6 p.m. clearing up a bit but cold wind blowing & heavy clouds drifting fritzs Baloons up first time I’ve seen them, one just opposite Villers Bretonneaux. Just got orders to go to the front & relieve two of my men there for 3 or 4 days. Go Tomorrow
Entry.286:
off this morning leaving Pack behind. arrived here about 11-30 a.m. Raining & Cold wind blowing, fritz shelled the track just before we got to it, holes each side of the road. Am in a tin hut Keeps out rain & thats all. Pat & Jim gone back.

letter from Viv dated 1st May he must have gone a week or so ago. 

on

gas guard here at night so expect a lovely time of it in the wet at the camp I left there are 80 or more men some of them just arrived from Nucleus & have not been near the line for months yet they must send me 46 years old up here & leave those fit men back there & I’ve not got over the gas yet. On duty from 9 to 12 deferred Pay. £50-0-0 Owe me 32/6
Entry.287:
Rain stopped & sun trying to get a look in hot when it does. Just been shelled out of our tin hut fritz put about a dz shells uncomfortably close One just near the top & two just opposite guess Pat got out in time wonder if I am a Jonah every time I get in to the line or near it fritz shells hell out of us. deferred pay. £50-1-6 Owe me. 34/6 Boys Paid today did not draw anything fritz shelled all day. 7-30 p.m. Just got 7 of our men some of them very badly cut up this 
is
 a nice place wish I was out of it.
Entry.288: on duty last night from 12 to 3. but did not go off till ¼ to 4 fritzs planes up by the dz. & shelling hell out of us. also bombing he got seven more of our chaps last night B. Coy the others were 4 D Coy 3 Yankey engineers & 1 Tommy. one of the Yanks died in the ambulance his penis & privates were blown off & half his rear also got it in the stomache & Back. another of them had his hand blown off Jim Perkins was wounded in leg & arm Lcpl Miller hand blown off its unsafe to go out of your dug out, am on to night from 3 to 6 a.m. deferred Pay £50.3-0 Owe me 36/6
Entry.289:
A glorious morning quite hot now 7 a.m. been on duty since 3 a.m. had a quieter night last night our guns were very busy tho Only saw 2 fritz’s Machines this morning at 4. Plenty of ours over a little after wonder what to day with bring forth.

Pat & Jim should be back. We go forward tonight. deferred Pay £50-4-6. Owe me 38/6. Am up in supports now After 4 days was sent up here for two to three days at the most this is the way they keep their word in the Army, sent up here to relieve a strong young able bodied man & me going on 46 & gassed what next.
Entry.290:
Put in my first night in supports on guard for a long time now Fleurbaix was the last place I did any of this, must be very hard up for men fritz sent us a few shells to welcome us like just after we arrived one pretty close & where some days ago he wounded 3 men Its terribly hot this morning like Aussie & the planes are very busy so is fritzs artillery deferred Pay £50-6-0 Owe me 40/6

my home here is a little dug-out about 4 ft deep at one end a few sand Bags on the sides & front & a piece of gal iron on top. Guaranteed to keep out ironmongery no heavier than 2 oz There is a Big dug-out about 40 ft deep but there are the heads, Sigs, Runners, Batmen, Cooks. A.M.C. etc in this we common gas guard & S.O.S sigs stay on top. Received letter from Bank London dated Apl 19th telling me money there at last it was sent to 37th Bat in mistake to Pvt. R H Harris 3077 of course cable error thank heaven its arrived at last will see Maude now.

guns kicking up fearful row

one of our machines brought a Fritz down this morning just alongside of Villers Brettonneaux & about 700 yds from here The Fritz was an elderly man about 50. he was terribly mangled. in case anything happens to me I want this money returned to my Wife 70 Bridge Rd Camperdown. Sydney. Aust.
Entry.291:
On duty from 12 to 3 a.m. Our guns gave fritz hell all night & he only retaliated once or twice can’t understand it perhaps he’s short of ammunition This is my sixth day here think I’ll send my windy man back to his company 
Writing
 Wrote to Maud & the Bank to day, deferred Pay. £50-7-6 Owe me 42/6. Wrote to Amos also two of our chaps wounded last night one killed got 3 Prisoners 1 an officer & 3 huns killed. Not so hot today big storm somewhere close, so a lovely evening & just now not a gun firing don’t seem real.
Entry.292:
called up at 2 a.m. as Bombardment expected & a sort of no telling what was going to happen my time was 3 to 6 however Bombardment did start the 2nd Div. went over & we put over a Barrage to help them a bit very lively for 2 hours don’t know how they got on one of ours brought in wounded (Bullet). a glorious night & similar morning our Planes been over more than an hour now its about 5 a.m. & the sun just coming along. deferred Pay. £50-9-0 owe me 44/6.

The air is full of our Planes & the machine guns are like type writers. Wrote to Nell. Posted letters to Nell, Maude, Bank London & Amos Williams.

been very warm to day Fritz has got High Velocity gun on us now shell arrives as soon as the report. on duty 9 to 12. midnight heavens how our guns do fritz up.
Entry.293:
this was the day fritz was going to astonish the world, didn’t keep me awake all the same & we are as we were a week ago.if he wanted good weather it would be hard to beat this clear moonlight nights, warm & hot days. fancy he got a greater gruelling than we supposed & hasn’t recovered yet. deferred Pay. £50-10-6 Owe me 46/6 been very hot again but nice cool evening

Fritz been dropping shells much closer to us today. My two beauties have not returned yet 8 days since I relieved them.
Entry.294:
And still fritz hasn’t startled the world but we gave him some hurry up last night wouldn’t have been on his side of the fence for Quids Kept at him all night every now & then Barrages. getting very hot here & feel it after the cold weather goodness knows when we are going to get a spell out of the danger zone been it since 29th Jany. 122 days. a bit stiff. deferred pay. £50-12-0 Owe me 48/6

got my chit signed last night for the Bank wonder when I shall get leave to use it.
Entry.295:
4.30 a.m. Been on since 3. glorious morning

our guns been going all night as usual guess fritz will have something to think of if he comes this way. We bomb him all night also.Couple of wounded men in during the night but small wounds. Our Planes are over him now. fritz put a shell close to us yesterday evening sent us down below. Just in front of me on top of the Bags, when I am duty, is a skull. Put there by someone who thought it funny Its very old & of course some French man or

woman was buried here & was unearthed when they built this big dug-out. Its certainly uncanny & seems to be saying you’ll soon be with me

In front of my dug-out is a grave with a cross along it made of lumps of chalk. its Board at the head reads, to an unknown Anzac. Poor chap not even known & never will be, his People will only know that he is missing. Have not mentioned another Village (Fouilloy) that has been knocked silly same as the rest near Corbie.

def pay £50-13-6 owe me 50/6.
Entry.296:
Heavy clouds & much cooler this morning trying to rain, the usual heavy Bombardment almost all night. Fritz over bombing Amiens & surroundings last night got a dump also This morning at 5 saw 11 of them but the anti aircraft guns soon sent them home they are only brave when no one can see them such as night time There were 6 of ours coming to meet them & the cowardly swine turned tale & ran no relief yet have done 11 days here now fancy Pat shelley will be looking for another job soon. deferred Pay £50-15-0 owe me 52/6

11-30 pm just going on duty at 12 to 3 very cold wind blowing our guns playing up a hell of a row. We were shelled here this afternoon 3 or 4 times got quite unhealthy at times.
Entry.297:
Cold & wet, back to winter again leaving here tonight for another Posi a few hundred yds away, dangerous spot Cpl Rex & others killed there last time

my two windy’s still out. deferred Pay. £50-16-6. Owe me 54/6.

got here about 9.30 its one of the Terraces & dug-out built in to the side of it 

about 11 oclock fritz

Put a few shells very close to us one on top of the bank just above me put the wind up me alright. On duty from 3 a.m. to 6
Entry.298:
weather cleared up but still a bit cloudy. my two beauties still away. guns never stop they tore it into fritz this morning thought he was coming over. on duty to night from 9 to 12. deferred Pay. £50-18-0 Owe me 56/6. went to Corbie & had a Bath & clean change of new shirt, sox, & underpants feel much better.

Corbie has beautiful houses & Factories all smashed also the church a fine one.

The soil is all chalk underneath & the dug-outs are all white it gets into your clothes & all over you & when it Rains is like butter to walk on slip & slide.
Entry.299:
fine morning sun hot, cloudy. fritz sent gas over last night & again between 4 & 6 this morning but we knew it was coming & the time so there you are.

Heavy artillery fire all night as usual. his planes dropping Bombs pretty close to here about 12.30 midnight. Sent letter to R.S.M. Dumne protesting about my being kept here 14 days instead of 4 shall get rid of shilley first opportunity. deferred Pay £50-19-6 Owe me 58/6 6. p.m. Been nice day got cooler & nice Breeze blowing now the gun straffing will soon begin now our Planes very active. Posted letters to Nell & Viv – (Sydney) on from 12 to 3 a.m.
Entry.300:
Had an exciting time of it this morning fritz deluged us with gas shells again just as I was going off duty. woke all the fellows up & had to put in another

hour till he finished his shelling. the wind turned in our favour & drove the gas away towards Corbie he’s been shelling like the devil ever since but we gave him jip before he started. Sun warm but very heavy clouds about. deferred Pay. £51-1-0 Owe me 60/6 have written to Maude. Getting relieved tomorrow 16 days of it

On duty 3 a.m. to 6.
Entry.301:
glorious morning, sun very hot, our Planes been up since about 3-30 Bombing Fritz’s lines Great Barrage put on him last night thought he was coming over here

have heard that the offensive has started near Reims & up at Locre & that he has pushed through, no particulars. Posted letter to Maude. deferred Pay. £51-2-6 Owe me 62/6. Back again to details had an awful walk of it shelled all the way to Daours. quite done up. Came along Canal & Railway.
Entry.302: had a good nights rest got up at 6-30 & had shave & cleaned my Boots feel tip-top now just a little stiff Am Quarter Master here again etc. deferred Pay. £51-4-0 owe me 64/6 2 letters each from Nell & Syd 1 from Tony & Carol yesterday. also one from Amos. Am sending his Razor & strop today. Posted it cost 1 franc Registered. the amount he sent. Been cool all day though fine Planes very active on other side
Entry.303:
Went for 2 Prisoners Hascher & Canon for Court Martial at Daours

pretty hot this morning, had to walk about 3 miles to get them then have to take them back & then home again about 10 miles no dinner & late for tea, got a little tea. I’d like to have my way with these malingerers. Been a lovely

day, fine & Hot deferred Pay £51-5-6 owe me 66/6 Guns very quiet to day expect they will make up for it tonight.
Entry.304: Another glorious day, sun very hot, fritz dropped Bombs by the Ton round here last night & this morning also shells got very close to here at times. had a go in with Sgt OBrien & Sgt Maj Harrison over lights last night there will be trouble if they repeat it tonight. Our men coming out tonight for spell of about 10 days, going about 6 or 7 kilos away deferred Pay. £51-7-0 Owe me 68/6
